title: Barcelona, Inter and Juventus approach Joao Cancelo over January transfer
description: Barcelona, Inter Milan and Juventus have made contact to sign Al-Hilal full-back Joao Cancelo in January, reports Italian transfer expert Fabrizio Romano.The Portuguese international wants to leave th...
fullText:
Barcelona, Inter Milan and Juventus have made contact to sign Al-Hilal full-back Joao Cancelo in January, reports Italian transfer expert Fabrizio Romano.

The Portuguese international wants to leave the Saudi Pro League giants in January after falling out of favour with manager Simone Inzaghi.

Following a hamstring injury, Cancelo was excluded from Al-Hilal‚Äôs squad for the domestic competitions in the first half of the season. He predominantly featured in the AFC Champions League Elite.

The Italian manager is planning not to register the former Manchester City star for domestic competitions for the remainder of the season, putting his future in jeopardy.

The 31-year-old is targeting a return to Europe to get prominent game time and maximise his chances of securing a place in Portugal‚Äôs World Cup squad.

Inter have lined up Cancelo as a potential loan target due to Denzel Dumfries‚Äô long-term injury.

The Dutch wing-back underwent ankle surgery earlier this month and is expected to return only in March.

The Nerazzurri manager Cristian Chivu has struggled to fill Dumfries‚Äô void, with Luis Henrique‚Äôs performances not up to the mark.

Meanwhile, Barcelona are looking to add a top-quality backup for Jules Kounde to reduce his workload and maintain his form.

Cancelo spent the 2023/24 season on loan at Camp Nou during Xavi‚Äôs reign. He has a strong attachment towards the La Liga giants and would be willing to return for his second stint.

However, Barca‚Äôs financial difficulties will prevent them from landing Cancelo. More so, their priority is finding a centre-back on a short-term basis following Andreas Christensen‚Äôs ACL injury.

Juventus are also exploring the market for a right-back due to Joao Mario‚Äôs exit speculation.

Despite being limited to the AFC Champions League, Cancelo has shown his class by racking up a goal and two assists in four games in the competition.

title: Seedy K‚Äôs GameCap: California
description: Louisville 90, California 70. Put your hands down, class, I know what your question is. Has a Louisville team ever before been whistled for 16 fouls in a half? Which U of L was in the opening twenty at venerable Haas Pavilion. My definitive answer after checking the media guide is a definitive probably not.
fullText:
Put your hands down, class, I know what your question is.

Has a Louisville team ever before been whistled for 16 fouls in a half?

Which U of L was in the opening twenty at venerable Haas Pavilion.

My definitive answer after checking the media guide is a definitive probably not.

On December 10, 1953, the Cards were flagged for 43 total in a 71-78 L at Siena.

OK, it is for sure. The laws of mathematics dictate they must have had more than that in one, probably both halves.

The Cards, despite being -12 at the line in the 1st, led by 14 at the break, 48-34.

Thanks to coming out scorching, draining their first five shots, three Sananda Fru deuces, and a pair of triples, one by Ryan Conwell, the other by Isaac McKneely.

Cal never pulled closer than 7, and the Cardinals never led by less than double digits after the 12:10 mark of the opening stanza.

OK, here‚Äôs my question: WTF was Vangelis Zougris doing in the game just past midway through the 2d?

During his three minute stint, the Golden Bears went on a 9-0 thrust.

VZ was technically only -9 (the only negative +/- for a Cardinal). But technically he was really -14. But Pat Kelsey wisely benched him after he committed one of the stupidest deadball Ts I‚Äôve ever witnessed. Which resulted in five more California tallies, two FTs and a trey.

The bracing 14 point run cut the margin to 73-62 with 6:27 left.

Then¬† U of L‚Äôs maturity reigned.

Adrian Wooley scored a second chance deuce, then followed it with a triple.

The seven point skein steadied the situation.

U of L ‚Äî playing shorthanded without Mikel Brown or Kasean Pryor ‚Äî kept Cal‚Äôs measure the rest of the way.

It was simply one of the oddest twenty point victories I can recall.

Midway through the 2d, the Cardinals led 68-43 and were teetering. Ryan Conwell had just been called for his fourth foul. Woeful marksmanship after intermission to that point. 7/19. 2/10. But the Bears, perhaps the most mediocre 12-1 squad in memory, were more inept. 5/19. 1/9. For the half, U of L was actually +4 at the line at that moment.

Soon thereafter came the Zougrisian Abominata.

Steadiness and that much appreciated level headedness prevailed.

Louisville only committed 9 infractions in the 2d, one less than the home team.

For the tilt, the Cards were +19 off the glass, +20 in the paint.

Though Conwell led Louisville in scoring with 26, for my money, it was the Hadley glue and the Wooley bully ‚Äî couldn‚Äôt help myself ‚Äî that were most key.

JH had 11 with 9 boards and 3 assists. AW had 21, many were important answers and thrust stoppers.

Sanny Fru was also boffo. He fashioned his first double double with 13 and 14.

Kobe Rodgers was a steady, calming presence. As usual. Khani Rooths was strong in his 18 minutes. And McKneely remains way more an all around positive than most expected.

Overcoming a cross country trip, significant foul trouble, the absence of two key ballers, in your conference opener on the road for a 20 point W is not to be sneezed at.

Next: a trip down to Silicon Valley for a date with Stanford Friday night in Palo Alto.

title: Brady Quinn slams Lincoln Riley for Notre Dame comments
description: The Irish QB for not happy over a 'PR stunt'.
fullText:
Brady Quinn slams Lincoln Riley for Notre Dame comments originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Former Notre Dame quarterback Brady Quinn went after USC coach Lincoln Riley on Tuesday, accusing him of driving the decision to pause one of college football‚Äôs most storied rivalries.

While on FOX Sports Radio, Quinn went off about Riley‚Äôs public comments on the future of the Notre Dame-USC series. Quinn compared Riley‚Äôs tenure at USC to that of former coach Clay Helton, noting Riley‚Äôs 35-17 record and a single win over Notre Dame in four attempts in not a good look.

Quinn also shot down Riley‚Äôs claim that Notre Dame backed away from its ‚Äúanytime, anywhere‚Äù scheduling stance. Quinn said USC proposed dates it knew Notre Dame could not accept due to existing commitments, framing the offer as a public-relations move rather than a genuine attempt to preserve the rivalry.

‚ÄúHe hasn‚Äôt won a conference championship, hasn‚Äôt made the Playoff, and hasn‚Äôt won a Rose Bowl,‚Äù Quinn said, calling it ‚Äúrich‚Äù for Riley to question Notre Dame‚Äôs motives.

üèàLincoln Riley says that USC isn't to blame for the cancellation of the Notre Dame rivalry.

üì∫@Brady_Quinn gives @TheJonasKnox and @LaVarArrington every reason why this is just a PR move by the Trojans and how they are the REAL reason why this rivalry got canceled. pic.twitter.com/OXjWvLCLoP

‚Äî FOX Sports Radio (@FoxSportsRadio) December 30, 2025

Quinn went further, revisiting Riley‚Äôs departure from Oklahoma and rumors linking him to LSU, arguing Riley has consistently avoided tougher competitive paths.

According to Quinn, shelving the rivalry strips USC of a defining annual stage. ‚ÄúThat game brought relevance,‚Äù Quinn said. ‚ÄúAnd it‚Äôs gone because he knows he can‚Äôt win it.‚Äù

title: 2025 was the year that one era ended at Manchester City and it gave birth to what comes next
description: 2025 will be looked back upon as a year of transition for Manchester City. The first half of 2025 saw Pep Guardiola‚Äôs team claw their way to Champions League qualification and also lose the FA Cup f...
fullText:
2025 will be looked back upon as a year of transition for Manchester City. The first half of 2025 saw Pep Guardiola‚Äôs team claw their way to Champions League qualification and also lose the FA Cup final to Crystal Palace. At the end of the 24/25 season, a host of club legends departed the club, and a new wave of players and leaders has taken their place. Although City haven‚Äôt claimed silverware throughout 2025, the year may well be looked back upon as the one that gave birth to Manchester City‚Äôs next era of success.

2025 began with Manchester City in need of a refresh. It was clear as 2025 began that the iteration of Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side that began this calendar year was on its last legs. The well was dry as City legends legs had nothing left to give. Players such as Kyle Walker, Ilkay Gundogan, and Kevin De Bruyne had reached their physical limit. On top of that, injuries had ravaged Pep Guardiola‚Äôs squad. City hit the 2025 January transfer window with gusto. Abdukodir Khusanov, Vitor Reis, Nico, and Omar Marmoush all joined the club to reinforce the City squad. Each player showed flashes of what they could add to Manchester City‚Äôs play. In the case of Omar Marmoush, his goals were crucial in helping City ultimately secure Champions League football for the 25/26 season.

There are too many individual moments and matches to go over that defined the first half of 2025. In the end, Pep Guardiola tweaked his lineup to make his team hard to beat. That tactical shift worked as City secured third place in the Premier League and made the FA Cup final. From the mire that surrounded Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side to begin 2025, something was salvaged for City from a difficult situation.

At the end of the 24/25 season, a host of club legends departed Manchester City. Kevin De Bruyne didn‚Äôt have his contract renewed at the end of last season. De Bruyne received a farewell from the Manchester City fans that was fit for a player of his status. It was sad to see De Bruyne leave City but at least he got the farewell he deserved. Ederson left Manchester City for Fenerbahce late in last summer‚Äôs transfer window. Unfortunately, Ederson didn‚Äôt get his own farewell at the Etihad. Given how integral he had been to Manchester City‚Äôs success Ederson did deserve his moment in front of the City faithful.

Kyle Walker left Manchester City on loan to join AC Milan last January. Walker‚Äôs loan move was a sad ending to his City career. Kyle Walker was key in Manchester City‚Äôs success but the way his City career ultimately ended was sad to watch unfold. The England international returned to City after his loan spell at AC Milan before moving to Burnley last summer. The circumstances that Walker left in as club captain did leave a sour taste in the mouth. It doesn‚Äôt diminish Walker‚Äôs achievements at City but perhaps he could have handled his departure, and loss of pace better to leave City on better terms.

Jack Grealish and Manuel Akanji left City on loan for season long loans at Everton and Inter Milan. Grealish played a key role in Manchester City‚Äôs treble-winning season in 22/23. From that point onwards, Grealish didn‚Äôt ever reach that level again and it was sad to see him go out on loan. Although it was for the best. Manuel Akanji gave everything to the cause at City, and he played a key role in Manchester City‚Äôs success during his spell at the Etihad.

Lastly, Ilkay Gundogan left City for Galatasaray. Gundogan returned to the club for the 24/25 season from Barcelona. Last season didn‚Äôt go as Gundogan would‚Äôve liked but he left City for the second time with his reputation intact as a club legend.

As club legends and important players left City a host of new signings arrived. Rayan Ait-Nouri, Tijjani Reijnders, Rayan Cherki, James Trafford, Gianluigi Donnarumma, and Sverre Nypan were all signed by City last summer. Cherki, Donnarumma, and Tijjani Reijnders have all provided a lift to Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side. Trafford and Ait-Nouri haven‚Äôt established themselves in the first team at City. Trafford has Gianluigi Donnarumma in his way. Ait-Nouri was hit by injury and the strong form of Nico O‚ÄôReilly at left-back has seen Ait-Nouri yet to make an impact at City. Sverre Nypan is a signing for the future and is on loan at Middlesbrough this season.

As the 24/25 season ended and before the 25/26 season began, Manchester City participated in the FIFA Club World Cup. Although City‚Äôs tournament ended early at the hands of Al-Hilal, the time spent in the United States by Pep Guardiola‚Äôs squad has been key in their revival. Baby steps were taken by the new-look City squad and those steps have become strides as the 25/26 season has progressed.

Although Manchester City began the 25/26 season with two defeats in their first three Premier League matches, this City side has now grown. They sit second in the Premier League, are well-placed in the Champions League, and have made the Carabao Cup semi-final stage. Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side isn‚Äôt at its best, there is still improvement to come.

Erling Haaland, Phil Foden, Jeremy Doku, Rayan Cherki, Nico, Nico O‚ÄôReilly, Matheus Nunes, Josko Gvardiol, Ruben Dias, and Gianluigi Donnarumma have established themselves as the next iteration of Pep Guardiola‚Äôs side. Rodri is yet to return properly after a serious ACL injury. Hope is high for what Manchester City could achieve entering 2026.

2025 has been a year of transition at Manchester City. After so much success across seven seasons, that was bound to happen eventually. During the first half of 2025 City did what they had to do. But the seeds planted at the end of the 24/25 season or in the first half of 2025 have begun to sprout.

Entering 2026 it is clear to see that Manchester City has turned the corner. 2025 is ultimately the year the club had to have. It was sad at times. It was also frustrating on other occasions. As 2025 ends, hope is high for 2026 and beyond at Manchester City.

title: Devils Coach Sheldon Keefe Rips His Team After Loss To Maple Leafs
description: After New Jersey Devils captain Nico Hischier fought Matthew Knies while trailing the Toronto Maple Leafs, Sheldon Keefe criticized his squad.
fullText:

title: Derrick White is the Celtics ‚ÄòName to Know‚Äô Player of the Game in Tuesday‚Äôs win over Jazz
description: Derrick White started the night slow, but he was much better in the second half as the Celtics beat the Jazz on Tuesday.
fullText:
The Celtics got back in the win column, downing the Jazz 129-119 on Tuesday in Utah. It was a tough open for the C‚Äôs as the starters didn‚Äôt have much energy early. But it was all Boston in the second half to sprint away with the victory.

Derrick White took over in the second half, making him Tuesday‚Äôs ‚ÄúName to Know‚Äù Player of the Game. The Name to Know Player of the Game is sponsored by John‚Äôs Sewer and Drain Cleaning, the Name to Know when your drains don‚Äôt flow.

It was a slow start for White, including missing his first seven 3-pointers on the night. But he finished the game with 27 points, seven rebounds and six assists, including a career-high seven blocks. White scored 22 points in the second half, helping the Celtics to the victory.

It was a forgettable shooting night to start for White, but his impact goes beyond just how many points he scored. The defense was on full display as he was seemingly flying everywhere and swatting shots. White also finished 8-for-16 from the field, including 2-for-10 on his 3-pointers. It helped that he was 9-for-9 from the free throw line.

The Celtics dropped a disappointing loss to the Trail Blazers last time out, so Tuesday‚Äôs victory was a much-needed bounce-back. The Jazz had beaten the Pistons and Spurs in their last two games, so they were playing solid basketball coming into Tuesday‚Äôs game.

The Celtics are now 2-1 on their five-game road trip, mostly against West opponents. They face the Kings on Thursday then the Clippers on Saturday to wrap up their longest road trip of the season.

title: Rookie VJ Edgecombe drops 3-pointer with seconds left in OT to give 76ers victory over Grizzlies
description: Edgecombe's calculation, he mistimed his game-winner in overtime.  ‚ÄúTo be honest, I was actually trying to go when the buzzer (went) off, but it was a little bit too early," Edgecombe said.  Edgecombe, the 6-foot-4 guard out of Baylor, connected on a 25-foot jumper with 1.7 seconds left, capping a 25-point night, and giving Philadelphia a 139-136 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies on Tuesday night.
fullText:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) ‚Äî By rookie VJ Edgecombe's calculation, he mistimed his game-winner in overtime.

‚ÄúTo be honest, I was actually trying to go when the buzzer (went) off, but it was a little bit too early," Edgecombe said. ‚ÄùBut it went in, and that's all that matters."

Edgecombe, the 6-foot-4 guard out of Baylor, connected on a 25-foot jumper with 1.7 seconds left, capping a 25-point night, and giving Philadelphia a 139-136 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies on Tuesday night.

Edgecombe, the third overall pick in the 2025 draft, brought the Sixers back into the game in the fourth quarter. He scored 13 points in the period, going 5 of 10 from the field, including 3 of 4 from outside the arc. A pair of 3-pointers near the four-minute mark helped erase a Memphis advantage. His 3-pointer with 1:55 left in regulation gave the 76ers a 128-121 lead, but Memphis behind Ja Morant, pulled even at 128, sending the game into the extra period.

After Memphis took an early lead, baskets by Tyrese Maxey and Joel Embiid (34 points each), and Paul George (17 points) tied the game. A drive by Memphis guard Morant tied the game at 136 with 18.3 seconds left, setting the stage for the game-winner.

‚ÄúMy teammates have faith in us to make a play, and that's what happened,‚Äù Edgecombe said.

‚ÄúIt's a big shot,‚Äù Sixers coach Nick Nurse said. ‚ÄúObviously, a game-winner for a rookie is pretty cool.‚Äù

Nurse has admired the poise of Edgecombe, who is averaging 15.5 points a game.

‚ÄúHe's kind of like that all the time,‚Äù Nurse said of the rookie guard. ‚ÄúI never see him show much emotion. I think it's an incredible quality. He just plays the game.‚Äù

title: Diamondbacks General Manager Drops Ketel Marte Update Amid Red Sox Interest
description: The last couple of weeks of the offseason have not had much movement, but rumors surrounding the Boston Red Sox continue to fly. Ketel Marte has become a hot name on the trade block, and the Red Sox are rumored to be interested in him. According to¬†The Boston Globe‚Äôs Alex Speier, Marte is one of [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The last couple of weeks of the offseason have not had much movement, but rumors surrounding the Boston Red Sox continue to fly.

Ketel Marte has become a hot name on the trade block, and the Red Sox are rumored to be interested in him. According to¬†The Boston Globe‚Äôs Alex Speier, Marte is one of the Red Sox‚Äôs primary targets. Arizona Diamondbacks general manager Mike Hazen dropped an update on where the team stands on trading Marte.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre very likely to put an end to this shortly‚Ä¶‚Äù Hazen said on Tuesday, per MLB.com‚Äôs Steve Gilbert. ‚ÄúBut this isn‚Äôt going to continue to linger. We need to focus our offseason. Again, my gut this whole time was that (a trade of Marte) wasn‚Äôt going to happen, and I think it seems likely that that‚Äôs the case and we want to focus on other things we need to do.‚Äù

The Diamondbacks reportedly have a high price tag on Marte, and Hazen knows teams may not be willing to meet their demands. Hazen also noted that he has not given interested teams a deadline, but they know time is running out.

The Red Sox‚Äôs top target is reportedly Alex Bregman, and their interest in Marte seems to be as a backup plan. However, he may not be on the board much longer.

The Red Sox seemingly want Bregman back, but it may require Craig Breslow to go out of his comfort zone. Bregman wants a long-term deal and Breslow has not given out such a contract since taking over.

However, he spoke highly of Bregman at the winter meetings and knows the impact he had in the clubhouse as well as on the field. He is one of the best free agents available, and Boston would be wise to keep him around.

title: Celtics get back in win column with big second half vs. Jazz
description: The Boston Celtics got back in the win column with a victory over the Utah Jazz, getting revenge from their first meeting in November.
fullText:
The Boston Celtics continued their West coast road trip on Tuesday, looking to bounce back from their loss in Portland on Sunday, and out for revenge against the Utah Jazz. It was a high-scoring affair for both teams, which is the norm in Salt Lake City, but the Celtics defense, especially from Derrick White, was ultimately the key for the victory.

After a slow start for both Derrick White and Jaylen Brown in the first half, the two were able to turn it on, including White, who was without a doubt the most important player of the game. White finished the night with 27 points, 7 rebounds, 6 assists, and a career-high 7 blocks, showing his special ability as one of the team's most valuable and efficient players on both ends of the court.

Here's a quick recap of the Celtics 10-point win over the Jazz on Tuesday night:

Second half surge: Scoring 59 points in the first half, Boston came out well in the second and put up a total of points in the second half. The Celtics were carried by White and Brown who had timely buckets throughout, and the aforementioned defense by White who had 7 of the team's 9 defensive blocks. Utah kept the game close throughout the first three quarters, but when they needed their stars, Boston was able to rely on them and see them pull out the victory.

Points in the paint: In their first meeting this season in which Utah got the win, Boston was dominated on the offensive side of the glass, giving the Jazz plenty of second chance opportunities. Even with Lauri Markkanen and Jusuf Nurkic down low in the paint, the Celtics outscored the Jazz 56-46 in points in the paint, which is a good sign for them as they struggled in shooting 30% from 3-point range.

Turnovers: Along with the 9 blocks from their team, the Celtics defense was all over the young Jazz team, forcing 13 turnovers, 8 of which came off of steals. Between the blocks and steals, Boston was all over the court on Tuesday night and making it uncomfortable for the Jazz is ultimately what helped carried them to pull away in the final minutes.

CAREER HIGH 7 BLOCKS FOR DERRICK WHITE!! pic.twitter.com/V3FaHLsaMA

‚Äî Danielle Hobeika (@DanielleHobeika) December 31, 2025

This will be the first of two matchups this season between two franchises going in opposite directions during the 2025 season. The Celtics, even without Jayson Tatum, find themselves right in the mix at the top of the Eastern Conference standings, while the Sacramento Kings, coming into December 30, have just 8 victories on the year. Predominately led by veterans DeMarr DeRozan and Russell Westbrook, the Kings have a wide gap in the experience factor on their roster. Boston will look to start another winning streak and start the 2026 calendar year on a high note.

This article originally appeared on Celtics Wire: Celtics get back in win column with big second half vs. Jazz

title: Duct Tape Time! Young Red Sox Infielder Switching to Devers‚Äô No. 11
description: A new No. 11 will be manning the infield at Fenway Park in 2026.
fullText:
When Rafael Devers was shockingly traded away on Father‚Äôs Day during the 2025 season, he ended up changing from the No. 11 he wore the first eight and a half years of his career in Boston to No. 16 with his new team in San Francisco. With the Giants having retired Hall of Fame pitcher Carl Hubbell‚Äôs No. 11 back in 1944, it took that number off the table for the then-28-year-old third-baseman-turned-designated-hitter-turned-first-baseman.

That also meant Devers‚Äô No. 11 opened up as an option for the Red Sox to hand out to any new players being added to the roster, whether that be via trade or in the way of minor league players getting called up to the majors.

Despite multiple players having the option to nab ‚Äústicks‚Äù as a number over the course of three and a half months, no one jumped at the opportunity.

But as 2025 comes to a close, one of last season‚Äôs newcomers is making the switch.

Just like everyone who has taped over their Mac Jones No. 10 Patriots jerseys, it‚Äôs time to break out the duct tape!

Marcelo Mayer is officially switching from No. 39 to No. 11, meaning one of Boston‚Äôs most exciting young players will once again be rocking the number once made famous in this region by Drew Bledsoe and Julian Edelman.

Boston Red Sox Reportedly Looking For Bullpen Help

Lucas Giolito Is Caught in Baseball‚Äôs New Free Agent Gray Area

Craig Breslow Trades Because He Has To

Nate Eaton is also changing numbers, moving from No. 40 to No. 18, while recent trade acquisition Willson Contreras will take over No. 40.

The changes were updated on the Red Sox‚Äôs official website on Tuesday.

During Devers‚Äô run in No. 11, he earned three All-Star selections, won two Silver Sluggers, and played a central role on the 2018 World Series team at only 22 years old.

Now, the number passes to Mayer - and with it, at least some added attention.

The 23-year-old infielder is expected to take on a larger role in 2026 after a learning-on-the-job rookie season. Mayer was called up from Worcester earlier than expected in 2025 after Alex Bregman‚Äôs quad injury led to infield instability, and slashed .228/.272/.402 while showing flashes of the tools that made him one of the organization‚Äôs top prospects in the hot corner.

Where Mayer ultimately settles defensively remains tied to how the rest of the offseason unfolds. He could open the year as the everyday second baseman, or slide over to where he spent most of last season at third, depending on how the roster shakes out.

Either way, Mayer stepping into No. 11 feels symbolic.

It‚Äôs not about replacing Devers - that‚Äôs impossible. But it does reflect where the Red Sox are headed: turning the page, handing responsibility to the next wave, and seeing who‚Äôs ready to carry it.

The number is new. The opportunity is bigger.

title: Illinois' Bret Bielema achieves unthinkable milestone in Music City Bowl win vs. Tennessee
description: A last-second Illinois field goal lifted Bret Bielema into a rare category of firsts in school history. And he may just be getting started.
fullText:
Illinois' Bret Bielema achieves unthinkable milestone in Music City Bowl win vs. Tennessee originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The 2025 Liberty Mutual Music City Bowl was a game of momentum. Luckily for Illinois, coach Bret Bielema had the last laugh.

A David Olano game-winning field goal opposite the¬†Tennessee Volunteersas time expired¬†Tuesday night in Nashville was the fitting final chapter of a two-year program stretch that can best be described as remarkable.

A 19-7 mark in the last two seasons, alongside finishing 13-4 in one-score games, shows just how far Bielema has taken the Illini. Better yet, he is the first coach in school history to lead Illinois to two seasons of nine wins or more back-to-back and finish the year with consecutive bowl wins when all is said and done.

Bielema told reporters the come-from-behind win, which saw senior quarterback Luke Altmyer engineer a 13-play, 64-yard drive while nearly eating the final five minutes of regulation, was bigger than just help from the Naperville, Illinois, native.

"I remember dealing with some adversity with both these guys, but also a lot of success," Bielema said, "I think as a head coach, one thing that really, it does define your success is after they leave you, what do they do, right?"

Bielema said he is excited to see where Altmyer and defensive back Miles Scott end up, should they get drafted next spring.

"But I'm going to watch both these guys play in the NFL and I'm going to smile a lot, right?" Bielema said. "Because you were with them on their journey."

The "journey" saw highs and lows for an Illinois team that remained in the College Football Playoff mix through mid-November, a feat unachievable just five years ago.

Bielema said he wants this year's team to be remembered as a group where togetherness was the main catalyst while also taking a swipe at the SEC.

"I know I think SEC is now 0-4 and we'd be 5-0 in the Big Ten," Bielema said. "I'm going to take that every day, right? Uh, so, um, little propaganda there, but propaganda is good propaganda."

Now, the off-season officially begins in Champaign.

title: Everything Bret Bielema said after Illinois beat Tennessee in the Music City Bowl
description: Illinois football coach Bret Bielema met with the media following his team's 30-28 victory against Tennessee in the Music City Bowl.
fullText:
NASHVILLE, Tenn. ‚Äî Illinois football coach Bret Bielema met with the media following the¬†Fighting Illini's 30-28 victory over the¬†Tennessee Volunteers¬†in the Music City Bowl.

Here is the full transcript of what the Illinois coach had to say in the news conference, starting with his opening statement as he sat beside seniors Miles Scott and Luke Altmyer:

Opening statement: "First, I just wanna say thank you to the Music City Bowl. From the time we got the invitation to where we are today, just took care of us, all of our families, all of our players, to be at the hotel and to share the experience this week.

"But ultimately, to have the game today, get another victory two years in a row now against the SEC opponent. Give all the credit to Tennessee, a really good football team. Got tremendous respect for Coach (Josh) Heupel and his staff and what they've been able to accomplish this year.

"But I'm super excited for these guys, these two guys to my left, just represent everything about Illinois football. Obviously, there's a win and all that goes into it, but these two guys represent everything you want college football to be. So these games are always great, but they're also very sad.

"I had a very tough time in our meeting last night cuz I knew this was gonna be the last time I was with a variety of guys. And to give them this moment that they'll carry with them. But bowl games are unique in the fact that you carry them for the entire six months before we play again.

"So really excited about that. With that, we'll open it up for some questions."

Recap: Illinois wins dramatic Music City Bowl with field goal in final seconds

Question: Coach ‚Ä¶ will you take us through that final game-winning drive?

Bielema: "Really, we had five minutes. I knew that if we had a feeling we would be able to score.

"I didn't know if it was gonna be a field goal or a touchdown. But once the drive kinda continued to happen, great execution by Luke on the third and sixth to get him to jump, which made it to third and one. And then centered it up there for David Olano to hit his game win field goal.

"But I really knew the ball in nine's hands, we were gonna be in good shape. I was just hoping that we could take it down to minimal clock for our defense. Not that we didn't have confidence, but we just needed to take the air out of their tires and kinda make it all ours."

Question: Coach, it was a 94-yard kick return right before that that gave Tennessee the lead. How were you guys able to sustain things despite a sudden change like that?

Bielema: "Well, I would just say this. It's not what happened, it's how you react to what happened. We preach it, we talk it, we live it.

"Obviously, an unfortunate deal. They had the ball hit the ground. They got around our right edge. I know there was some leakage up there in the middle, and then their guy created a play. Hey, you're playing a team with a lot of good players. But it's not that act that's gonna end us. It's gonna be our reaction. And then obviously our offense went out and did it very, very well. So super excited for our guys."

Question: Coach, with 19 wins in two years ‚Ä¶ What's happening to you guys and these guys up here?

Bielema: "We have talked a lot about different numbers, and I showed them last night. When we got done with the last win of the year with Northwestern at home, there were several records that we had either tied or broke, right? And I knew that if we got this one tonight, that would set all kinds of records. And we don't have to read about other years anymore. I think people usually either read about history or write history. And this group's writing history.

"And I think we'll continue to do that. ‚Ä¶ I believe that puts us at 13-4 in one-score games over the last several years, which is just an incredible statistic. And I think a lot of it is that Luke has a lot of confidence. But when Luke shows his confidence through the way he plays, it makes everybody else around him play very, very well. So a very contagious player, and it affects the whole team."

Question: Brett, you went for it on a couple fourth downs, had David kick three times. What kind of went into those decisions?

Bielema: "Well, the first two and a half were, David felt good from the 25, 27-yard line going that direction. So we were just outside of those marks, and I would rather go for it, rather than try to punt it away or pooch it.

"So both of those, I would do again 100 times over. We went for a fourth down on a couple of those drives there at the end, and it ended up working our way. So David's a very good field goal kicker, but it just felt for us to win the game, we need to be aggressive in those moments.

"And for the most part, it played in our favor. Then when you put the game in his foot, I guess, instead of his hands, just what was kind of your thoughts as he went out there? Well, not just David. David would be the first to tell you, right, the snapper, the holder. ‚Ä¶ And a lot of really, really good things that when you have confidence in your kicker, but also in the operation, that makes you play the game. I give credit to my coaches.

"Ben Miller is a huge asset to our football team on the sidelines. He and I were talking through the fourth quarter clock situation there at least five or six times in the last seven or eight minutes that ended up playing out to a tee."

Question: Brett, when you look back on the 2025 season, what is probably going to be your biggest takeaway from it, and why?

Bielema: "Well, I tell our players all the time, right? As players and coaches, you're often defined by your record, right? Like the wins and losses, but for me as a head coach now, just finished my 17th year as a head coach, it's the memories that are created.

"With these guys, I remember the first time Miles walked into my office, or the first time Luke walked into my office. I remember dealing with some adversity with both these guys, but also a lot of success. I think as a head coach, one thing that really defines your success is after they leave you, what do they do, right? Both these kids, both these guys come from incredible people, families, moms and dads that have put them in these positions.

"But I'm gonna watch both these guys play in the NFL, and I'm gonna smile a lot, right, because you were with them on their journey. So just these memories, it's kind of funny, both of them are sitting here. My youngest daughter asked me about Luke Altmeyer literally on an every-day basis.

"And we were sitting in a team meeting, or a team meal at the country club, one of the last meals we had, and my daughter walks up, sits on my lap. She goes, where's Miles? I said, Miles Scott? She said, yeah, all the boys in my class wanna be Miles Scott.

"And I just was smiling because he's a defensive player that has turned his life into a former wide receiver to a DB. And now that there's young people in this community that wanna be Miles Scott, they have no idea how much that makes me as a head coach feel, but so proud of what they've accomplished in so many ways. So the 2025 season was a team that beat two bowl games back-to-back against SEC teams.

"I think SEC is now 0-4, it would be 5-0 in the Big Ten. I'm gonna take that every day, right? So a little propaganda there, but propaganda is good propaganda."

Question: I guess Brett, now that Luke is done, can you put a bow on what he meant for the elevation of this program and why he was able to take this program?

Bielema: "Yeah, I think the two things that I always take from Luke is just, he took a chance on us, right? He had a million different opportunities. He was a very sought-after player in the portal. I love the fact that he stayed with his team because they needed him through the bowl game, which really gave us the chance to have it.

"And we thought we were gonna have Tommy back. And then when that got denied, it kind of made us late to the portal. And since he was late coming out, that actually made everything in our favor.

"But the growth for me as a head coach, what I've learned from Luke and his end-of-half, end-of-game scenarios, we have these meetings and his voice that he speaks with his confidence. But then to see the reaction of our fans and the people say so many things about what he's accomplished. And his mom and dad always talk about they dropped off a young man that was kind of in a tough spot from where he came from. And it brought him here to Champaign in the middle of January. It was cold and they were dropping him off and leaving him. And now he's coming out of here, he's about as confident and full of a very, very, very bright future. That's probably what I'll always think about."

Beating the SEC and loving Luke: Social media reacts to Illinois bowl victory

Question: Just defensively, what did you feel like worked out well today and allowed you guys to be aggressive and get a lot of negative plays?

Bielema: "We wanted to make sure that we got our feet in the grass and we could read and react and play a little bit more zone than we've ever probably played. Which I think took them off their mark a little bit. But it gets some pressure up front. The good thing was we knew they're a good offense. They created a few plays. But the defense always bowed up.

"I think that stop in the first half to hold them to a field goal. It went wide right, was a really, really big deal. And then the offensive response.

"But yeah, there was a lot of great efforts out there. Really all three phases win this game. We talk about it all the time, right? Penalties, mental errors, and turnovers. But we did not commit those, they did. And then on the flip side of it, we had three keys to victory. And our last key was to have great situational football awareness and execution. And that was defined in the fourth quarter here today. So really fun to see a game plan work out."

This article originally appeared on Journal Star: Everything Bret Bielema said after Illinois beat Tennessee in the Music City Bowl

title: Brees, Fitzgerald, Belichick finalists for NFL Hall of Fame
description: The former Saints quarterback is a headliner of the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
fullText:
Brees, Fitzgerald, Belichick finalists for NFL Hall of Fame originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Former Saints quarterback Drew Brees is on a fast track to the Pro Football Hall of Fame ‚Äî and few would argue otherwise.

The Super Bowl XLIV champion was named one of the 15 finalists for the Class of 2026, placing him one step away from enshrinement in Canton.

The Hall‚Äôs 50-member selection committee will vote on the finalists next month, with the results announced Feb. 5 during ‚ÄúNFL Honors.‚Äù Under the current format, between three and five modern-era finalists will be inducted, marking the second year of the revised process.

Brees‚Äô r√©sum√© is among the strongest in NFL history. He ranks second all-time to Tom Brady with 80,358 passing yards and 571 touchdown passes. After spending the first five seasons of his career with the San Diego Chargers, Brees signed with New Orleans in 2006 ‚Äî a move that changed both his career and the franchise‚Äôs trajectory.

He became the face of a city rebuilding after Hurricane Katrina and ultimately led the Saints to their first Super Bowl title following the 2009 season, earning Super Bowl MVP honors in a win over Peyton Manning and the Indianapolis Colts.

Over his career, Brees was selected to 13 Pro Bowls, won AP Offensive Player of the Year twice (2008, 2011), earned first-team All-Pro honors in 2006 and was named second-team All-Pro four times.

Joining Brees as finalists are first-year eligibles Larry Fitzgerald, Jason Witten and Frank Gore. Willie Anderson, Torry Holt, Luke Kuechly and Adam Vinatieri earned automatic finalist status after advancing to the final seven for the Class of 2025.

Returning finalists include Eli Manning, Reggie Wayne, Jahri Evans, Marshal Yanda, Terrell Suggs and Darren Woodson, while defensive tackle Kevin Williams reached the finalist stage for the first time in his sixth year of eligibility.

The committee will also consider senior candidates Ken Anderson, Roger Craig and L.C. Greenwood, along with coach Bill Belichick and contributor Robert Kraft. Between one and three of those candidates will be inducted.

Only four people were inducted last year, making it the smallest Hall of Fame class in the past 20 years.

title: 49ers Week 18 playoff seeding scenarios, potential playoff opponents
description: There is a ton to keep track of for the San Francisco 49ers in Week 18 should they lose to the Seattle Seahawks.
fullText:
The San Francisco 49ers enter Week 18 with one easy playoff seeding scenario: they're the No. 1 seed if they win their final game. But what happens if their six-game win streak is snapped at home Saturday night?

While fans may not want to consider the possibility of a defeat at the hands of the Seattle Seahawks at Levi's Stadium, it's worth exploring what happens should the 49ers fall, where they'd wind up seeded and what teams they could play in the first round if they miss out on the bye week.

Here are the seeding scenarios and potential playoff matchups awaiting the 49ers after Week 18:

This is tough to answer since there is no certainty just yet. San Francisco would secure a bye week on wild card weekend should they get the top seed. After that they'd be in line to host the lowest-remaining seed, which could very well be either the No. 5 or No. 6 seed which would be one of the Los Angeles Rams or Seahawks.

Two things would have to happen here, and it requires San Francisco to get some help by way of the division record tiebreaker. If the Rams beat the Cardinals, they'll have the same division record as the 49ers. That would move the next tiebreaker to record against common opponents where LA has a sizable advantage. If LA falls to the Cardinals, they'll finish with a worse division record than the 49ers, giving San Francisco the tiebreaking edge.

Securing the No. 5 seed would be preferable for matchup purposes if they're not getting the top spot. They'd have to go on the road for wild card weekend, but their opponent would be dependent on the outcome of Saturday afternoon's game between the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and Carolina Panthers.

Panthers win Week 18: 49ers at Panthers

Buccaneers win Week 18: 49ers at Buccaneers

Panthers-Buccaneers tie Week 18: 49ers at Panthers

This is the worst-case scenario for San Francisco, but it's probably likelier than the No. 5 seed.

Where the 49ers would go for their wild card game depends on how things shake out for the Chicago Bears and Philadelphia Eagles in their respective season finales. Chicago is currently the No. 2 seed and on track to host the No. 7 seed Green Bay Packers. Philadelphia has the same record as Chicago, but the Bears beat them head-to-head and hold that tiebreaker.

Bears win Week 18: 49ers at Eagles

Bears lose and Eagles lose in Week 18: 49ers at Eagles

Bears lose and Eagles win or tie in Week 18: 49ers at Bears

More 49ers: 49ers PFF grades: Best and worst grades from Week 17 win vs. Bears

This article originally appeared on Niners Wire: NFL playoffs: 49ers Week 18 seeding scenarios, potential opponents

title: Rumour Mongering: Chelsea Drop Out of Ordo√±ez Race
description: This seems to pave the way for a Liverpool move.
fullText:
According to a report by South American outlet Bola VIP, Chelsea have withdrawn from negotiations for Club Brugge‚Äôs Joel Ord√≥√±ez. It was said that Stamford Bridge was the player‚Äôs preferred destination, but the London club‚Äôs withdrawal has paved the way for a move to Liverpool FC. However, Inter Milan is said to be still monitoring the situation closely.

The 21-year-old Ecuadorian defender is actually a familiar name from earlier this summer, as he was also briefly linked with a move to Anfield before Liverpool eventually settled on Giovanni Leoni.

It may seem a little curious why Liverpool would ask a defender playing in the Belgian Pro League to make a giant leap towards playing in the Premier League, but Brugge had a very good Champions League campaign for their standards last season, and about 20% of Ord√≥√±ez‚Äôs 100+ appearances for the club have been made in Europe‚Äôs premier competition.

Ord√≥√±ez‚Äôs standout traits include his passing and general composure on and off the ball, which have made him one of the more promising young centre-backs in European football. Liverpool seem to be prioritising defenders who are good on the ball, with the failed chase for Marc Guehi and the signing of Leoni over the summer highlighting their desire for defenders of that profile.

With Leoni out for the season, Liverpool need some bodies in that department, and they can fulfil both long- and short-term needs if they choose to pursue Ord√≥√±ez. The player is expected to cost around ‚Ç¨40m. Liverpool do have some good history with centre-backs named Joel, so we‚Äôll see if this one gains further traction as the winter transfer window opens.

title: Barcelona monitoring Algerian talent Ibrahim Maza at AFCON 2025
description: Barcelona are reportedly tracking Bayer Leverkusen‚Äôs Algerian prodigy Ibrahim Maza at the African Cup of Nations 2025 (h/t Mundo Deportivo).The 20-year-old has been in scintillating form for Algeria...
fullText:
Barcelona are reportedly tracking Bayer Leverkusen‚Äôs Algerian prodigy Ibrahim Maza at the African Cup of Nations 2025 (h/t Mundo Deportivo).

The 20-year-old has been in scintillating form for Algeria, scoring in the 3-0 win against Sudan. He also produced a solid display in the 1-0 win against Burkina Faso.

Barca scouts have been impressed by Maza‚Äôs performances, with the Catalan giants adding him as a potential future target.

Leverkusen paid ‚Ç¨12 million for Maza‚Äôs services from Hertha BSC in the summer, and he has made a significant impact this season.

He has netted four goals and three assists for Die Werkself in all competitions, while garnering wider attention for his impressive displays in the Champions League against Manchester City and Newcastle United.

Operating as a No.10, Maza ranks among the elite dribblers and creative passers in Europe. His shooting prowess makes him a dangerous outlet in the attacking third.

The Algerian prospect has been pivotal behind Leverkusen‚Äôs resurgence under Kasper Hjulmand, with the Bundesliga giants now sitting third in the table following a disastrous start to the season.

Maza‚Äôs stock could skyrocket if he continues his fine form with Algeria at the AFCON. He will be next in action against DR Congo in the Round of 16.

Barca are currently stacked with quality attacking midfield options such as Dani Olmo and Fermin Lopez.

However, Hansi Flick‚Äôs men will not pass up a chance to sign a top-quality talent like Maza, given Olmo‚Äôs injury struggles and lack of consistency.

Barca‚Äôs priority will be adding a centre-back and a striker for the summer of 2026.

Nottingham Forest‚Äôs Murillo, Borussia Dortmund‚Äôs Nico Schlotterbeck, Atletico Madrid‚Äôs Julian Alvarez, and Levante‚Äôs Karl Etta Eyong are some of the reported targets.

title: PROFILE | Samson Baidoo ‚Äì Lens steal gem from under Premier League side‚Äôs noses
description: From the moment reports broke that RC Lens were close to signing Samson Baidoo from Red Bull Salzburg in the summer, a very obvious comparison awaited the Austrian international. As a centre-back capa...
fullText:
From the moment reports broke that RC Lens were close to signing Samson Baidoo from Red Bull Salzburg in the summer, a very obvious comparison awaited the Austrian international. As a centre-back capable of playing in the middle of a back three, it was hard to ignore the idea that Lens had found their successor to Kevin Danso, who had left midway through last season for Tottenham Hotspur.

Lens had tried hard to keep their interest in Baidoo a secret for as long as possible. They had to work quickly and quietly or else they would lose momentum, as the 21-year-old was on the radars of far richer clubs in the Premier League, but they had not yet been stirred into action. As soon as news leaked that Lens had made contact, they knew that these clubs would have bids readied. And that is exactly what is reported to have happened.

L‚Äô√âquipe wrote that two Premier League clubs sent delegations to try to swoop for Baidoo. They offered a far more lucrative deal to the club and the player, but it was too late. Lens had, in stealth, laid out the groundwork in a reported ‚Ç¨8m deal and provided a convincing case for why the Austrian should continue his progress in France. A case that was helped by their former player.

Baidoo would tell the French outlet that Danso had spoken to him before the move, telling him, ‚ÄúThat if I want to focus solely on football, [Lens] is the place to be. He‚Äôs changed here as a person, as a player. He‚Äôs given me a lot of confidence.‚Äù It‚Äôs a decision that has worked out perfectly for the young defender; he has put in a star turn in a team that has climbed to first in the league on the back of their unflinching defensive performances.

This is all the more impressive when considering that this is a Lens side that had its defence decimated over the past two transfer windows, with the sales and departures of the likes of Danso, Abdukodir Khusanov, and Facundo Medina. Baidoo has helped make the memory of those players a distant one, and it is becoming increasingly obvious that when he eventually leaves the north of France, it will be for far more than they originally signed him for.

title: Marvin Harrison injury: Arizona Cardinals WR has new foot injury
description: Cardinals WR Marvin Harrison Jr. is dealing with a new injury in Week 18.
fullText:
Arizona Cardinals wide receiver Marvin Harrison Jr. is dealing with another injury in a season that has been disappointing. On Sunday against the Cincinnati Bengals, he exited the game with an injury that head coach Jonathan Gannon said was his heel.

Gannon clarified that it was not Harrison's heel that he injured. It was his foot.

Harrison was playing in his second game back from a heel injury. While many believed he reaggravated the same heel, it was actually an injury to his other foot.

Harrison has missed four of the last seven games. He missed two after he had his appendix removed. He got hurt in Week 13, injuring his heel against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 13. He missed two more games and then had a limited load against Atlanta and Cincinnati.

Will he play in the finale on Sunday against the Los Angeles Rams? Gannon gave the standard statement: ‚ÄúIf he's healthy enough to play, he'll play.‚Äù

In 12 games this season, Harrison has 41 receptions for 608 yards and four touchdowns. He did not have a catch on Sunday against the Bengals, getting targeted just once.

title: Derrick White Joins NBA History In Celtics‚Äô Win Over Jazz
description: The Boston Celtics secured an impressive 129 to 119 victory against the Utah Jazz on Tuesday night, with guard Derrick White shining as the standout performer. White finished the game with 27 points, seven rebounds, six assists and seven blocks. White is recognized as a standout defender, but recording seven blocks in a single game [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Boston Celtics secured an impressive 129 to 119 victory against the Utah Jazz on Tuesday night, with guard Derrick White shining as the standout performer.

White finished the game with 27 points, seven rebounds, six assists and seven blocks. White is recognized as a standout defender, but recording seven blocks in a single game is truly remarkable.

It‚Äôs tough for any player to record seven blocks in a game, but for a 6-foot-4 guard, it becomes even more challenging.

White‚Äôs seven blocks have now tied him for the most by a guard in a single game, according to Basketball Reference.

Four other guards in NBA history recorded seven blocks in a game: Doug Christie, Tracy McGrady, Dennis Johnson and George Gervin.

Most blocks in a game by a guard in NBA history, per @bball_ref:

Derrick White ‚Äì 7 (tonight)
Doug Christie ‚Äì 7
Tracy McGrady ‚Äì 7
Dennis Johnson ‚Äì 7
George Gervin ‚Äì 7 pic.twitter.com/3H4auDNPG1

‚Äî Underdog NBA (@UnderdogNBA) December 31, 2025

Since being traded to the Celtics in 2022, White has established himself as one of Boston‚Äôs standout players. With Jayson Tatum sidelined due to a torn Achilles this season, White has stepped up significantly, taking on a much larger role.

title: 2025 Season Review: Ulsan HD
description: Three managers, 12 fewer wins than the champions, 16 losses, and the third-fewest goals scored. It was a disaster of a 2025 Hana Bank K League 1 season for Ulsan HD, finishing ninth and only surviving...
fullText:
Three managers, 12 fewer wins than the champions, 16 losses, and the third-fewest goals scored. It was a disaster of a 2025 Hana Bank K League 1 season for Ulsan HD, finishing ninth and only surviving relegation on the last day.

Ulsan avoided the relegation playoffs, the indignity of what could have been. That is about as good as it gets domestically after what has been a very strange season, a relative disaster. Finishing ninth with safety only secured on the final day, and only done so via default with results elsewhere going their way, represents a dark year for a club that had come off three consecutive K League title wins.¬† The Horangi's ACLE campaign has been decent, though, with two wins, two draws, and two losses so far, and they are just about on course to reach the knockouts.

The generation shift didn't pan out, nor did two managerial appointments. Kim Pan-gon was shown the door, then not long after, so was Shin Tae-yong. There appears to have been dressing room unrest as a result of said managerial appointments, meaning academy director and former Jeonnam manager Noh Sang-rae who was appointed caretaker, in an underwhelming pick as can be, had a thankless task on his hands to steer this juggernaut away from danger. Across the three managers, Kim Pan-gon earned eight wins, Shin Tae-yong just one, and Noh Sang-rae three.

Things weren't looking too bad for Ulsan until the build-up to the Club World Cup, but three losses in the U.S., having departed for the tournament on the back of a defeat, seemed to create a snowball effect that just couldn't be slowed down. The Horangi were toothless and went on a run of 11 without a win, but then a 1-0 victory over Jeju was followed up with three straight losses and a run of seven without a win in the league. Once the going got tough, even with the experience of Kim Young-gwon, Lee Chung-yong, Jo Hyeon-woo, Jung Woo-young, and the like, Ulsan just could not get out of that rut.

A lack of firepower meant Ulsan were the joint-second lowest scorers in Final B and third-lowest overall.

Choi Seok-hyeon's versatility gets him the nod for Ulsan's young player of the year ahead of winger Yoon Jae-seok (30 apps, 1 goal), and attacking midfielder Back In-woo (12 apps, 1 goal). Choi looked confident enough to slot in as either a right-sided centre back in a three or right back in a four, he even popped up at left midfield on a couple of occasions. Choi made 23 appearances and had his best run from July to October, featuring in nine of 11 games from Round 23 to 32. The signing of Jung Seung-hyun has pushed Choi down the pecking order, leaving him as third or fourth choice to partner Kim Young-gwon, but it was a solid second season for the 22-year-old, first at K League 1 level.

He was accused of being too tidy a footballer, not gritty enough for a relegation battle with his "pretty technique" by then-manager Shin Tae-yong, but Swedish central midfielder Darijan Bojanic was a very important player for Ulsan again this year. With a lot of sideways passes and a lack of direction in Ulsan's midfield at times, Bojanic offers a less shackled approach, gliding from box to box. Without the Swede in central midfield, Ulsan were often guilty of sticking to a 4/4 in musical terms, but Bojanic has the chops to play more expressively, in 5/4 or maybe 7/8 at the right moments. He should be central to Ulsan's rebuild for 2026.

Lee Jin-hyun, attacking midfielder

The signing of Lee Jin-hyun looked like a real coup with the former Pohang, Daegu, and Daejeon attacking midfielder returning to K League from a one-year spell in Poland. He would have had plenty of suiters for his signature, but for whatever reason, Lee Jin-hyun just never got going in a Ulsan shirt.¬† The same could be said for a lot of Ulsan's recruits in 2025, but with three managers and a lot of off-the-field drama, it's perhaps understandable. Lee managed one goal and two assists in the league, but is a player who managed three goals and six assists for Daejeon in 2023 before departing for Ekstraklasa side¬†Puszcza Niepolomice, and just doesn't become a bad player overnight.

Finding the silver lining of 2025 is that it can't get much worse for Ulsan. Club legend Kim Hyun-seok has been appointed as manager, so there should be some goodwill among the supporters for the time being. Kim should at least be given time to shape this squad. Ulsan have a big squad, even with key departures like Gustav Ludwigson and Um Won-sang, so it may be more about the shape Kim opts to set this Ulsan team up in. Last season with Jeonnam Dragons, Kim used a 5-3-2 for the most part but a back three was used by 11 times last year by two different managers, yielding just two wins. During Kim's highly successful season at Chungnam Asan in 2024, which saw the Owls finish second, his system was more of a 4-3-3 with some tendency to use a back three. Do Ulsan have the wingbacks for a back three/five? Homework for Kim Hyun-seok.

title: Tobias Harris injury update: Detroit Pistons forward exits vs Lakers
description: Detroit Pistons veteran forward Tobias Harris exited the first half of their road game against the Los Angeles Lakers on Tuesday, Dec. 30.
fullText:
LOS ANGELES ‚Äî Detroit Pistons veteran forward Tobias Harris exited the first half of their road game against the Los Angeles Lakers on Tuesday, Dec. 30 with a left hip sprain.

It's unclear when the injury took place, but Harris left the game with 6:12 remaining in the first quarter. The Pistons announced the injury after the quarter ended, adding that he wouldn't return for the rest of the game.

Harris finished the night with seven points on 2-for-2 overall shooting. The Pistons are closing out a five-game West Coast road trip against the Lakers and are looking to snap a two-game losing streak.

title: Warley's 22 points and 14 rebounds help No. 7 Gonzaga beat San Diego
description: ‚Äî Jalen Warley had 22 points and 14 rebounds as No. 7 Gonzaga held off a late charge to beat San Diego 99-93 on Tuesday night for its 20th straight win against the Toreros.Gonzaga (14-1, 2-0 WCC) was making its final trip to San Diego as a member of the West Coast Conference. However, the Bulldogs will still make annual trips to face San Diego State after the schools begin play in the new-look Pac-12 starting next season.Tyon Grant-Foster scored 18 points while Mario Saint-Supery and Braden Huff had 14 apiece for Gonzaga, which won its seventh straight game since its only defeat, a 101-61 loss to then-No.
fullText:
SAN DIEGO (AP) ‚Äî Jalen Warley had 22 points and 14 rebounds as No. 7 Gonzaga held off a late charge to beat San Diego 99-93 on Tuesday night for its 20th straight win against the Toreros.

Gonzaga (14-1, 2-0 WCC) was making its final trip to San Diego as a member of the West Coast Conference. However, the Bulldogs will still make annual trips to face San Diego State after the schools begin play in the new-look Pac-12 starting next season.

Tyon Grant-Foster scored 18 points while Mario Saint-Supery and Braden Huff had 14 apiece for Gonzaga, which won its seventh straight game since its only defeat, a 101-61 loss to then-No. 7 Michigan in the championship game of the Players Era Festival in Las Vegas.

Graham Ike, Gonzaga‚Äôs second-leading scorer and leading rebounder, was limited by foul trouble and had 11 points and nine rebounds in 23 minutes. He picked up three fouls in the first half, including a technical in the final minute, and sat for the first 6 1/2 minutes of the second. Shortly after subbing back in, he committed his fourth foul and headed back to the bench.

Ty-Laur Johnson scored 21 points for San Diego (6-8, 1-1), while Juanse Gorosito had 16, Darrae Goodwin 15, Adrian McIntyre 12 and Toneari Lane 10.

NO. 12 NORTH CAROLINA 79, FLORIDA STATE 66

CHAPEL HILL, N.C. (AP) ‚Äî Caleb Wilson had 22 points in North Carolina‚Äôs win over Florida State.

Wilson also had 16 rebounds and six assists for the Tar Heels (13-1, 1-0 Atlantic Coast Conference). Seth Trimble scored 20 points while shooting 6 of 13 from the field and 8 for 11 from the line and added seven rebounds and four steals. Kyan Evans had 15 points and went 5 of 15 from the field (5 for 12 from 3-point range). The Tar Heels picked up their seventh straight win.

The Seminoles (7-7, 0-1) were led by Chauncey Wiggins, who recorded 16 points and 10 rebounds. Kobe Magee added 12 points for Florida State. Robert McCray finished with 11 points, six rebounds and eight assists.

NO. 13 NEBRASKA 86, NEW HAMPSHIRE 55

LINCOLN, Neb. (AP) ‚Äî Payton Sandfort scored 19 points and No. Nebraska shook off a second straight slow start to beat New Hampshire and go undefeated in nonconference play for the first time since 1928-29.

The Cornhuskers (13-0) extended the best start in program history but not before the Wildcats (4-9) of America East, like North Dakota of the Summit League nine days earlier, caused some anxious moments.

The Huskers led by just three at halftime but were much sharper on both ends after that and will ride momentum into Friday night‚Äôs Big Ten home game against ninth-ranked Michigan State.

Braden Frager scored 15 points and Berke Buyuktuncel added 14 for the Huskers. Jack Graham had 15 of his 17 points in the first half to lead New Hampshire.

NO. 16 LOUISVILLE 90, CALIFORNIA 70

NO. 19 TENNESSE 105, SOUTH CAROLINA STATE 54

KNOXVILLE, Tenn. (AP) ‚Äî Ja‚ÄôKobi Gillespie had 21 points and eight assists to lead Tennessee to a win over South Carolina State.

Nate Ament scored 16 points and Amari Evans added 14 for the Volunteers (10-3). Jaylen Carter had 13 points and 10 rebounds and J.P. Estrella finished with 12 points and 10 rebounds.

Jayden Johnson scored 25 points for the Bulldogs (1-14).

title: Wisconsin safety Preston Zachman will enter transfer portal after injury-marred season
description: Preston Zachman, a member of Wisconsin's 2020 recruiting class, will play elsewhere in 2026. A leg injury limited him to three games i 2025.
fullText:
As a member of Wisconsin‚Äôs 2020 recruiting class, Preston Zachman was one of the Badgers‚Äô longest tenured players.

For the 2026 season, he seeks a change of scenery.

The veteran safety, who missed most of the season due to a leg injury, will enter the transfer for his final season of eligibility. On3 reported the news and Zachman reposted it on his X and Instagram accounts.

Zachman, who is 6-foot-1, 212 pounds, suffered the injury against Alabama on Sept. 13. After that he could be seen on the sideline during games wearing a walking book on his left leg.

Prior to the injury, Zachman was a vital piece of the Badgers' defense.

He finished this season with 12 tackles, nine solos, and tied for the team high with two interceptions. Both of those turnovers came in the second half of the season opener against Miami (Ohio) and helped UW close out a 17-0 victory.

He started 20 games for UW and played 35 overall.

‚ÄúHe was the leader of the defense,‚Äù Badgers coach Luke Fickell said Nov. 3. ‚ÄúHe was making most of the calls and was just that corner piece.

"It's been one of those things we've had to be able to overcome and had to spread out some of that (responsibility) the last seven weeks.‚Äù

News of Zachman‚Äôs departure came three days before the transfer portal opens. The Badgers might seek help at safety to offset the lost of Zachman as well as starter Austin Brown, who completed his eligibility.

Matt Jung, a rising senior, is expected to return. Matt Traynor, who was the third safety following Zachman's injury, is recovering from an ACL injury he suffered against Ohio State Oct. 18.

More: Wisconsin football transfer portal tracker: QB Billy Edwards will make his comeback elsewhere

More: A look at Wisconsin football's needs from the transfer portal

title: Nick Nurse is glad to see Maxey and Edgecombe thriving together in the backcourt
description: Tyrese Maxey and VJ Edgecombe had standout performances against the Grizzlies, and Nick Nurse is glad to see them work well together.
fullText:
Nick Nurse is glad to see Maxey and Edgecombe thriving together in the backcourt originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Philadelphia 76ers got a big win on Tuesday against the Memphis Grizzlies. VJ Edgecombe had a standout moment for the 76ers, as he scored the game-winning three-pointer. It was Tyrese Maxey who made the decisive pass, which led to the game winner, further cementing their status as a top backcourt in the Eastern Conference.

After the win against the Grizzlies, the 76ers are now up to fifth in the Eastern Conference standings. They are on the same number of losses as the fourth-seeded Toronto Raptors, but the Canadian team has played three more games compared to Philly. With how the 76ers played against the Grizzlies, they could go further up the standings.

As the 76ers' head coach, Nick Nurse has set his team up well for success. He has persisted with Edgecombe as a starter alongside Maxey, which is already paying off. It is still Edgecombe's rookie season, but he is playing like a seasoned veteran. That is huge for the 76ers because not only are they playing well, but they appear to be a good fit alongside each other.

This is good for the present, but also the long-term future. Edgecombe has the potential to be one of the best shooting guards in the league. Maxey is arguably a top-two guard in the Eastern Conference, so getting a running mate is huge. Considering the 76ers still have Joel Embiid and Paul George, they have a good mix of promising players, stars, and veterans.

More:¬†VJ Edgecombe hits game-winning shot in overtime

Moving forward, the 76ers have a reliable group of players with Maxey, Edgecombe, and Embiid. George can be a mixed bag, but he does have the resume to deserve to be one of the top players. Jared McCain is also on the roster, and he might not be as prominent as his rookie year, but he has the potential to be a long-term piece.

"First thing, it was nice to see those guys get rhythm up top for a good stretch of the game with their guard-to-guard screen, turned the corner a couple of times, and when they put two on the ball, we kicked it back out, made the right read... It's a big shot, game-winner for a rookie, pretty cool," Nurse said about the dynamic between Maxey and Edgecombe.

As the season progresses, Edgecombe will continue to get reps as one of the most reliable players on the 76ers roster. For a rookie, that is rare, but Edgecombe has enough talent and bravery to keep succeeding in Philly.

Nurse has done well to make everyone feel good in their roles, and Edgecombe is probably the happiest one. He is only a rookie, but he has shown that he is ready for the pressure, and he will continue to stand out amidst all the responsibilities he has with the 76ers.
