title: Tomlin ‚Äòoptimistic‚Äô Watt can return against Ravens
description: PITTSBURGH, Pa. (BLACK AND GOLD NATION) ‚Äì The last time T.J. Watt suited up in a game was on Dec. 7 against Baltimore.
fullText:
PITTSBURGH, Pa. (BLACK AND GOLD NATION) ‚Äì The last time T.J. Watt suited up in a game was on Dec. 7 against Baltimore. Steelers head coach Mike Tomlin is ‚Äòoptimistic‚Äô that his captain can play in round two against the Ravens.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm open to utilizing him in any way that‚Äôs appropriate relative to his availability,‚Äù Tomlin said. ‚ÄúBut certainly I‚Äôm more optimistic this week than I have been in previous weeks.‚Äù

Jerome Bettis looks back on ‚Äòstorybook ending‚Äô to career

Watt has missed the past three games due to a partially collapsed lung, which was caused by a dry needling treatment session at the team‚Äôs facility.

Last week, he participated in practice for the first time since having lung surgery. Tomlin told Black and Gold Nation that Watt looked ‚Äògreat‚Äô in practice despite the long layoff.

‚ÄúI doubt that T.J. is ever out of football shape or conditioning over the course of a 12-month calendar,‚Äù Tomlin said. ‚ÄúI just know how he lived his life and how he prepares, and how thoughtful he is in terms of what he puts in his body and how he trains.‚Äù

While he‚Äôs still in ‚Äòfootball shape,‚Äô Watt was just a limited participant during practices last week. Per Tomlin, the decision on playing the former first-round pick could come down to the quality and the number of practices he has this week.

That leads to the question posed by ESPN‚Äôs Brooke Pryor. Would he have to be a full participant during multiple practices this week to play on Sunday?

‚ÄúPractice participation certainly would be more comforting in terms of making a decision, given he‚Äôs coming back from a medical circumstance,‚Äù Tomlin responded.

Since it is a more unique circumstance, Tomlin does have to err on the side of caution when it comes to giving Watt the green light to play.

‚ÄúWe want to be cautious about how we work him back into the fold,‚Äù Tomlin added.

Three Steelers selected to Pro Bowl Games

It would be big for Pittsburgh to have Watt back in the fold. All-time, the Steelers have a 3-11 record in the regular season without the former Defensive Player of the Year.

One of the biggest games of his career could come on Sunday with an AFC North title on the line.

title: Steelers great Hines Ward misses out on 2026 Hall of Fame class
description: The former Steelers wide receiver will have to wait another year for a bid to Canton.
fullText:
Another year of Hall of Fame eligibility will end without a gold jacket for former Steelers wide receiver Hines Ward, who wasn‚Äôt among the list of 15 modern-era finalists announced by the hall Tuesday morning.

Ward has yet to be a finalist in any year he‚Äôs been eligible.

However, it is a loaded class for 2026, with the remaining finalists being as follows:

Ward still has a strong case himself, with 12,083 career receiving yards, two Super Bowls (including an MVP), four Pro Bowls, and being widely regarded as the greatest blocking wide receiver of all time.

However, one former Steeler remains a Hall of Fame possibility in the 2026 class, with Steel Curtain great L.C. Greenwood being announced a senior-category finalist earlier this year.

The final Hall of Fame class for 2026 will be announced at NFL Honors in February.

title: Highlights from MSU hockey's GLI championship victory over Michigan Tech
description: Check out highlights from the Spartans' Great Lakes Invitational championship victory over Michigan Tech
fullText:
It was a fun couple of days for Michigan State hockey up in Grand Rapids, Mich. this past weekend.

Michigan State picked up a pair of wins in the last two days to collect a second straight Great Lakes Invitational championship. The Spartans first beat Ferris State on Sunday, and then followed that up with a championship victory over Michigan Tech on Monday.

It was the first time in 25 years since the Spartans won back-to-back Great Lakes Invitational, and the first team in general to win the tournament in back-to-back years in 10 years. Prior to last year, Michigan State hadn't won the Great Lakes Invitational since 2009.

With another successful Great Lakes Invitational for the Spartans, it's worthwhile watching highlights from the win over the Huskies on Monday. Check out highlights from the Spartans' championship win in the social media post below:

Highlights from last night‚Äôs GLI Championship! üèÜ pic.twitter.com/uCF7IdgRZS

‚Äî Michigan State Hockey (@MSU_Hockey) December 30, 2025

title: Preview: No. 4 UConn men‚Äôs basketball vs. Xavier | 5:00 p.m., Peacock
description: The No. 4 UConn men‚Äôs basketball team returns to action after a 10-day layoff following its 72-54 win over DePaul on Dec. 21. The Huskies are back on the road yet again as they travel to Cincinnati to face Xavier (9-4, 1-1) on Wednesday afternoon at the Cintas Center. The Musketeers rank No.
fullText:
The No. 4 UConn men‚Äôs basketball team returns to action after a 10-day layoff following its 72-54 win over DePaul on Dec. 21. The Huskies are back on the road yet again as they travel to Cincinnati to face Xavier (9-4, 1-1) on Wednesday afternoon at the Cintas Center.

The Musketeers rank No. 100 in KenPom, with the No. 119 offense in the country, and 116th in the NET. These numbers aren‚Äôt great for a program that made two of the last three NCAA Tournaments, including just last season, but new head coach Richard Pitino has done a solid job building a team essentially from scratch that was competitive in non-conference play, perhaps more than a lot of people expected. The Musketeers beat both West Virginia and Cincinnati and lost by just one to Georgia.

As for UConn, the Huskies sit at No. 7 in KenPom and No. 8 in the NET. They have the fourth-rated defense in the country per KenPom, a continued step in the right direction from last season. The 12-1 Huskies‚Äô only loss was to now- No.1 Arizona by four points in a game where Tarris Reed Jr. and Braylon Mullins were both out with injuries. In their last game, Alex Karaban led the charge with 21 points and three triples against the Blue Demons.

The Huskies look to start 3-0 in Big East play for the third time in their six seasons since rejoining the Big East, as the team did so in 2022-23 (3-0) and last season (4-0).

Date/Time: Wednesday, Dec. 31, 5:00 p.m. EST

TV/Stream: Peacock, NBC Sports Network (for YouTubeTV subscribers)

Radio: UConn Sports Network, Sirius XM 85, Sirius/XM online streaming

Location: Cintas Center, Cincinnati OH

KenPom Predicted Score: UConn 79-67

The Huskies and Musketeers have played 12 times, with the past 10 coming in Big East play. UConn has a narrow 7-5 advantage over Xavier with a 6-4 split in conference action. They last faced off on January 25, 2025, when Xavier beat UConn, 76-72 at the Cintas Center. Solo Ball led four Huskies in double figures with 20 points.

As of this writing, all players are expected to be available for Wednesday‚Äôs game. This includes Solo Ball, who sat out the Huskies‚Äô previous game on 12/21 with a wrist injury. Dan Hurley said he‚Äôs been able to practice and will be good to go.

Remember the last time a Top 5 UConn squad traveled on the road on New Year‚Äôs Eve to Xavier? It ended in a Musketeer win. The 14-0 Huskies led by Adama Sanogo and Co. suffered their first loss of the year in a game where the Musketeers used a big second half to pull away and hand the Huskies their first loss, more or less starting that infamous January of 2023 where the eventual national champs really struggled.

That‚Äôs not a one-off either. In fact, UConn has lost 3 of 5 games on the road at Xavier since joining the Big East. In addition to that game in 2022 and last year‚Äôs matchup while Liam McNeeley was out, the Huskies lost during the 2021-22 season by six points despite a combined 40 points from RJ Cole and Tyrese Martin.

That Xavier team in 2022 had names like Colby Jones, Jack Nunge, Zach Freemantle, and Souley Boum. The 2025 Musketeers don‚Äôt have that, not even particularly close, but somewhere deep in the mind of Dan Hurley, he‚Äôs having flashbacks from the past.

With the new head coach in Pitino, no scholarship players from last year‚Äôs Xavier team who played a single minute are back with the program. The lone returner is Roddie Anderson III, but he sat all of last season in a redshirt year. Pitino brought in players from all different levels of college basketball to construct the roster.

Leading scorer Tre Carroll comes over from Florida Atlantic, where he was a key component to that Owls team that made the Final Four in 2022-23. Jovan Milicevic and Filip Borovicanin were both rotational frontcourt pieces for Pitino at New Mexico last year. Anthony Robinson and Pape N‚ÄôDiaye were both reserve bigs for Virginia and UNLV, respectively, a year ago and retain that role for the Musketeers.

In the backcourt, All Wright (one of the best names in the sport) comes over from Valparaiso fresh off a great freshman year. Malik Messina-Moore and Isaiah Walker are both seniors from the mid-major level that have a lot of experience and games under their belts. Overall, this group has a good mix of veteran leadership and promising young talent.

Xavier has played two completely different games to kick off Big East play this season. In their opener, they hosted a struggling Creighton team that was searching for a big win. The result? A 41 point Bluejay win that saw them knock down 16 threes and shoot 60% from the field. Carroll only scored 7 points, by far his season low. The Musketeers looked lost on both ends of the floor and were down 27 by halftime. It was looking like that eighth place pick in the preseason poll may have ended up being too high.

Then just a few days later the Musketeers traveled to Washington D.C. to take on Georgetown. After losing by over 40 points at home, it only made sense that they picked up a gritty road win on the road later on in the week. Carroll scored 22 points and Borovicanin had a double-double with 11 points and 13 rebounds in the 80-77 victory over the Hoyas.

With how well the Huskies have been playing early on in conference play with a pair of 18+ point victories, it‚Äôs easy to overlook some players who may be struggling or not playing up to their full potential that they‚Äôve shown in non-con play.

Malachi Smith is averaging 1 PPG and 1 APG through the first two Big East games after closing non-con with back-to-back 9-assist efforts vs. Florida and Texas. The Dayton transfer hasn‚Äôt been able to get a good rhythm going yet in league play, but he is averaging fewer minutes (15.5 in BE play, 19.8 in non-con).

Eric Reibe was everything UConn could have asked for and 

Both UConn and Xavier do a good job of getting everybody involved in the offense, and it shows. The Musketeers are first in the league in assists per game at 18.6, but the Huskies aren‚Äôt far behind at 18.2. Those are on 27.1 and 29.2 made field goals per game, respectively, too, so both sides rack up assists at a rate north of 60%. Borovician and Messina-Moore combine for 8 APG, and Carroll and Anderson each average 2.8. For the Huskies, Silas Demary Jr.‚Äôs 5.8 and Smith‚Äôs 4.0 carry the load, but Karaban and Reed Jr. each average at least 2 as well.

title: Chelsea and Bournemouth held in chaotic 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge
description: Chelsea and Bournemouth share frantic Stamford Bridge drawChelsea and Bournemouth served up a breathless 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge, a match shaped by ambition, uncertainty and one player who refused...
fullText:
Chelsea and Bournemouth served up a breathless 2-2 draw at Stamford Bridge, a match shaped by ambition, uncertainty and one player who refused to shrink from the moment. Antoine Semenyo, amid strong expectation of a ¬£65m move to Manchester City, played a decisive role for Bournemouth, creating two goals and conceding a penalty in a game that never settled.

Bournemouth struck first in the sixth minute when Semenyo‚Äôs long throw caused havoc and David Brooks finished from close range. Chelsea responded swiftly. Semenyo brought down Estevao Willian in the box and, after a VAR review, referee Sam Barrott pointed to the spot. Cole Palmer converted confidently before Enzo Fernandez curled a superb finish into the top corner to make it 2-1 inside 23 minutes.

The lead lasted barely four minutes. Once again Semenyo‚Äôs long throw proved decisive, Justin Kluivert reacting quickest to tap home. Bournemouth carried real threat thereafter and enjoyed the better of the first half, registering 14 attempts and testing Robert Sanchez repeatedly. For all Chelsea‚Äôs possession, Bournemouth‚Äôs directness unsettled them.

At the break, Enzo Maresca introduced Reece James and Pedro Neto, seeking control and urgency. Chelsea pushed higher, yet Bournemouth remained dangerous on the break. VAR dismissed appeals for handball against Malo Gusto, while Djordje Petrovic denied Estevao with a fine save from distance.

Chelsea had chances to win it. Fernandez blazed over from inside the box late on, the clearest opening of the second half. Joao Pedro replaced Palmer to audible frustration from the stands, reflecting a growing unease around Stamford Bridge. In stoppage time, Bournemouth nearly stole it when Enes Unal volleyed over from 12 yards after Amine Adli‚Äôs cross.

The draw leaves Chelsea with just one win in seven league matches and a worrying habit of surrendering leads, having now dropped 15 points from winning positions. December has been bruising, and confidence feels fragile ahead of a demanding trip to Manchester City without the suspended Moises Caicedo.

For Bournemouth, the performance carried encouragement despite extending their winless run to 10. Semenyo embodied their spirit, combining physicality, creativity and defensive discipline. Asked if this was his final appearance, Andoni Iraola said: ‚ÄúIt is not his last game. I can‚Äôt say 100 percent but I think he will play, yes.

‚ÄúHe needs to recover because we play Arsenal at home in another three days, against top of the league, he will be an important player for us, yes.‚Äù

Chelsea and Bournemouth remain searching for momentum, but on this chaotic afternoon, it was Semenyo who left the strongest impression.

title: Danny Jansen Seeking To Create Strong 1-2 Combo Behind Dish With Kyle Higashioka
description: Rangers POBO Chris Young acknowledges that Jansen is what the Rangers were looking for while noting the strength of the duo.
fullText:
Earlier this winter, the Texas Rangers signed veteran catcher Danny Jansen to a two-year contract.

Jansen will come into the Rangers catching room with Kyle Higashioka, and the pair will split time behind the plate this season.

Rangers POBO Chris Young acknowledges that Jansen is what the Rangers were looking for while noting the strength of the duo.

‚ÄúDanny is the perfect fit,‚Äù Young said. ‚ÄúA leader who brings a winning personality. He‚Äôll complement Kyle Higashioka, and the two of them behind the plate will make a great tandem.

Last season was a tale of two halves for Jansen, who spent the year with both the Blue Jays and the Brewers.

North of the border, Jansen struggled, hitting just .204 with 11 home runs and 29 RBI in 73 games.

Following the trade to Milwaukee, Jansen saw his offensive production increase despite playing in just 25 games.

Jansen hit .254 with three home runs and seven RBI for the first-place Brew Crew.

2026 will no doubt bring some pressure to Jansen, who will be coming in following the DFA of long-time Rangers catcher and fan favorite Jonah Heim.

title: Former Clemson OC identified as candidate for the job once again
description: Could Clemson bring in a familiar face to step back into the offensive coordinator position?
fullText:
Clemson‚Äôs search for its next offensive coordinator is already drifting toward familiar territory.

According to multiple reports, head coach Dabo Swinney parted ways with Garrett Riley on Monday, a move that immediately put the spotlight on how Clemson plans to reset an offense that struggled to find consistency throughout the 2025 season. Rather than casting a wide, public net, the early chatter has centered on comfort, trust, and prior success.

That‚Äôs where Chad Morris enters the picture.

Morris is well known in Clemson circles, not only for his previous stint running the Tigers‚Äô offense but for the long-standing relationship he shares with Swinney. Their history dates back more than a decade, and that familiarity could matter as the Tigers approaches a pivotal stretch with the transfer portal opening Jan. 2. Whoever steps into the role will be expected to stabilize the roster quickly while helping reestablish an offensive identity that has gone missing.

Although Morris hasn‚Äôt called plays on a full-time basis in recent seasons, he has remained close to the game. He spent 2024 coaching at Texas State, served in analytical roles earlier in the decade, and took the 2025 season away from coaching to watch his son lead Virginia to an ACC Championship Game appearance. Even during that time, Morris stayed connected, spending time around Clemson late in the season to assist with preparation.

Morris‚Äô original run with the Tigers remains one of the most productive offensive periods in program history. From 2011 through 2014, Clemson routinely ranked among the nation‚Äôs top scoring teams, set numerous school records, and established the foundation for its rise on the national stage.

Former Clemson wide receiver Troy Stellato back in the transfer portal https://t.co/yeBexsZ5v8 pic.twitter.com/Fkwy0xzJkI

‚Äî Clemson Wire (@Clemson_Wire) December 30, 2025

A return now would look very different than it did a decade ago. Morris has already experienced the head coaching path, and this opportunity would be about fit and familiarity rather than ambition. For a program searching for offensive stability, that distinction matters.

Contact us¬†@Clemson_Wire¬†on X (formerly known as Twitter), and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Clemson Tigers¬†news and notes, plus opinions

This article originally appeared on Clemson Wire: Former Clemson coach is a top candidate for the vacant OC job

title: Rapid Reaction: Northwestern basketball outlasts Howard 80-60 in Nick Martinelli‚Äôs return
description: After a sluggish first half, the Wildcats flipped a switch for a decisive victory to end non-conference play.
fullText:
A surprisingly close first half was in tow, but Northwestern (8-5, 0-2 B1G) was able to pull away for a gritty 80-60 win over Howard (9-6, 0-0 MEAC) in front of a packed house at Welsh-Ryan Arena in Evanston.

Much like the return of Grace Sullivan for women‚Äôs basketball against Washington, top scorer Nick Martinelli was back in the starting lineup after missing NU‚Äôs loss to Butler with a concussion. However, Arrinten Page was dropped from the starting lineup, sitting on the bench the entire game for ‚Äúviolating team standards,‚Äù according to the Big Ten Network broadcast.

Despite entering this game with the most efficient offense (49.1% FG) of the Chris Collins era through a season‚Äôs first 12 games, Northwestern has consistently been undermined by its defense. Teams under Collins have historically been defined by strong defensive identities, but that has not been the case this season.

With defensive ratings of 103.2 (KenPom) and 102.0 (Sports Reference), the Wildcats were posting their worst numbers since the 2014-15 season, where they posted defensive ratings of 103.2 (KenPom) and 104.7 (Sports Reference). The question then was whether that trend would continue.

Northwestern clung to a narrow lead for much of the game, and it felt like the ‚ÄôCats were never going to fully shake a persistent Howard squad, seeing their advantage cut to just two points early in the second half. Though Howard battled throughout, the Wildcats used a decisive late run to finally pull away, holding the Bison to just 32 second-half points.

Martinelli led the ‚ÄòCats offensively with a dominant 32 points and six rebounds, shooting 10-of-20 from the field. Tre Singleton provided a crucial all-around performance with 17 points, eight rebounds, five assists, two blocks, two steals and zero turnovers, playing with poise beyond his years.

For the Bison, it was Ose Okojie who kept Howard within striking distance for much of the contest. Okojie finished with a team-high 13 points, while Cam Gillus facilitated the offense with seven assists.

The difference in the game came from ball security and defensive pressure. Northwestern committed a mere five turnovers while forcing 14 from Howard, converting those into a decisive 21-6 advantage in points off turnovers. Though three-point shooting was nearly even, the Wildcats‚Äô aggressive drive-and-kick game earned them 34 free throw attempts to Howard‚Äôs 13, providing the necessary margin to secure the win.

Both offenses sputtered from the opening tip. The Wildcats missed their first four field goal attempts before Martinelli drew a foul and sank two free throws for the game‚Äôs first points. Howard responded with a back-cut layup, and the tone was set for a half defined by defense and missed shots.

The Wildcats‚Äô defense was active early, forcing eight turnovers and converting them into 13 points. A steal led to a transition foul on Angelo Ciaravino, who split a pair of free throws, and Singleton followed with a strong post move to put the Wildcats up 6-2.

Howard briefly found its range, as Alex Cotton and Cedric Taylor III hit three-pointers to take an 8-7 lead. But the Wildcats responded with their own perimeter spark from an unexpected 

The game remained tight until Mullins took over. Following a Howard turnover, he drained his third three-pointer in transition, forcing a Bison timeout with Northwestern leading 24-15 and 7:35 remaining.

Third trey for @jmsaucing, 15-2 run for the 'Cats üòº

üì∫ @BigTenNetwork pic.twitter.com/7JtSTsx9Ym

‚Äî Northwestern Basketball (@NUMensBball) December 30, 2025

Howard clawed back with a 5-0 run, capped by a Travelle Bryson dunk that prompted a timeout from Wildcats coach Chris Collins. Northwestern‚Äôs offense added seven more points before halftime, with a Jake West layup and a pair of Martinelli free throws coming off more Howard turnovers.

Mullins also rifled in his fourth three-pointer of the half to stay scorching hot and keep the ‚ÄòCats in front. A Bryson three and a tip-in second-chance lay trimmed the Wildcats‚Äô lead to 31-28 at the break.

Mullins was perfect in the half, scoring 12 points on 4-for-4 shooting from beyond the arc. Martinelli added 11 points for Northwestern, which shot 47.6% from the field and 62.5% from three-point range but attempted just 21 total shots.

Howard stayed close by dominating the glass, outrebounding the Wildcats 20-10 with seven offensive boards. Okojie led the Bison with seven points, while Bryson added nine off the bench. The Bison shot 39.3% from the field and 41.7% from deep.

The Wildcats needed a more assertive second half after letting Howard hang around, and they delivered. The energy shifted decisively in their favor, turning a nail-biter into a comfortable 80-60 victory.

The half began with the ‚ÄòCats sharpening their attack against Howard‚Äôs zone. Martinelli found space for a push jumper, and a strong defensive stand forced an early Bison timeout. The tone was set, though the Bison kept it close early, answering every Wildcat push.

The inflection point arrived midway through the half, and with the score tight, the Wildcats‚Äô depth and hustle began to overwhelm Howard. Singleton was the Mullins of the second half, as his relentless effort on the glass and efficient offense sparked the key run. A sequence featuring a Max Green steal, a Tyler Kropp finish and Singleton‚Äôs own three-point play stretched the lead to 50-42.

Defense ‚û°Ô∏è Offense

üì∫ @BigTenNetwork pic.twitter.com/OC4etPNPwN

‚Äî Northwestern Basketball (@NUMensBball) December 30, 2025

From there, Northwestern methodically pulled away. It continued to dissect the Howard zone, with Martinelli, Singleton and Jordan Clayton finding easy buckets.

Defensively, the Wildcats tightened the screws, generating turnovers and converting them into points. Jake West provided a steady hand, and even with Page sitting the entire game, the rotation had more than enough.

The final minutes were a formality. The ‚ÄòCats attacked the press with ease, Martinelli pirouetted for a layup and the lead ballooned to 20. The Bison‚Äôs spirit was broken, and Northwestern closed out a dominant 49-32 second half to secure the win, proving it can flip the switch when needed.

With non-conference play closed out on a high note, Northwestern will look to earn its first conference win and start 2026 right in a Saturday clash versus Minnesota at Welsh-Ryan Arena on Jan. 3 at 4 p.m. CST.

title: Maxxine Dupri Reflects On WWE Career Progress, Having A 'Hard Time' With Online Hate
description: Women's IC Champion Maxxine Dupri recently reflected on having a difficult time with hate she received online earlier in her career and how far she's progress.
fullText:
WWE Women's Intercontinental Champion Maxxine Dupri shocked the WWE Universe when she defeated Becky Lynch on the November 17 edition of "WWE Raw" to take the gold from "The Man," thanks to a little help from AJ Lee. Even before the victory, Dupri had already come a long way in WWE, from the manager of the Maxximum Male Models, to an actual in-ring competitor who is working hard to hone her craft. Dupri recently sat down with "The Wrestling Classic" and spoke about her evolution from fans booing her work during a live event to the point the locker room had to rally around her, to becoming champion.

"Thank you to my haters," she said. "Truthfully, that live event, specifically, that didn't affect me personally. In the moment... When you're new to this and you're wrestling, I can't hear anything. I'm trying to make sure that I just survive this match and do the best I can do."

Dupri explained she did, however, have a hard time with hate she was getting on social media. She described it as a lesson she needed to learn and said people are entitled to their opinions, and she's entitled to protecting her peace.

"I have my people that give me my criticism and I know the things that I truly do need to work on that I'm falling short in, and I will always hold myself accountable for that and put my nose down and keep grinding," Dupri said. "It was very challenging for a period of time, but there's pros and cons to everything and that's just part of this job."

Fans have been witness to a variety of video vignettes on "Raw" following her Women's Intercontinental Championship victory, showing Dupri working out in the Dudgeon alongside Natalya's "Low Key Legend" character, Nattie. Dupri said that Natalya, and her husband, former WWE star-turned-producer TJ Wilson, have single handedly changed the direction of her career thanks to their training.

"I think so much of this last year and everyone saying, 'Oh, Maxxine's improved a lot and we're seeing this new side.' It's truly what we do in the Dudgeon," she explained. "Nattie says [it's] finding my 'FU.' It's the way that they push me to my limits in there... Pressure makes diamonds. They have to break you to make you and that is what happens in the Dudgeon."

Dupri said that the things she's learning in the Dudgeon are applicable to what she needs to be doing to remain on top of things in her matches to be able to stay on the offensive, as well as to reverse certain moves. She credited her training for her victory in her recent match against Ivy Nile. Dupri is set to square off with Lynch for the Women's IC title once again on the first "Raw" of 2026.

If you use any quotes from this article, please credit "The Wrestling Classic" and provide a h/t to Wrestling Inc. for the transcription.

Don't miss any of the major wrestling headlines. You can also add us as a preferred search source on Google.

title: Optimism reigns supreme at Bayern Munich
description: FC Bayern had a very solid 2025.
fullText:
Bayern Munich president Herbert Hainer is appreciative of how good 2025 was to the club and is optimistic about the future in Bavaria.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been an eventful, exciting and special year, at the end of which we have well over 430,000 members, which says a lot about how much is being done right in this club, both on and off the pitch. On behalf of the club, I would like to thank all members and fans for their support and loyalty,‚Äù Hainer told FCBayern.com. ‚ÄúTogether, we can look back on an anniversary year with plenty of reasons to celebrate, which also gives us plenty of reasons to be optimistic: FC Bayern is in an excellent position, not least when you look at the league tables for our professional teams in both men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs football ‚Äì and above all beyond that.

‚ÄúIn sporting terms, we celebrated the ‚ÄòBavarian treble‚Äô with the men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs football championships and the basketball championship ‚Äì something that has never happened before, and the women also won the double for the first time in their history. Financially, our CEO Jan-Christian Dreesen was able to post outstanding results at the Annual General Meeting, and in social matters, we once again implemented many projects in which we‚Äôre committed to helping people in need, promoting open-mindedness and diversity. In recent weeks in particular, we‚Äôve been able to implement important decisions such as the extension of Vincent Kompany‚Äôs contract until 2029 and the acquisition of the Sportpark Unterhaching for the women‚Äôs team. We celebrated 125 years of FC Bayern and are in an excellent position to continue our success story.‚Äù

A big part of how others view 2026 will be tied to the success of the men‚Äôs team, which is in great position at the moment. Will Hainer have the same type of outlook at this time next year?

If you are looking for more Bayern Munich and German national team coverage, check out the latest episodes of Bavarian Podcast Works, which you can get on Acast, Spotify, Apple, or any leading podcast distributor‚Ä¶

title: Lisandro Martinez aims subtle dig at Amorim‚Äôs approach
description: Despite missing many of their heavy hitters, Manchester United fans must have been confident of claiming all three points on Tuesday.After all, the Red Devils were playing at home against bottom-of-th...
fullText:
Despite missing many of their heavy hitters, Manchester United fans must have been confident of claiming all three points on Tuesday.

After all, the Red Devils were playing at home against bottom-of-the-barrel Wolverhampton Wanderers, on the back of keeping a clean sheet against Newcastle last week.

However, the home side had to be content with a 1-1 draw at Old Trafford, in a game characterised by bizarre calls.

Ruben Amorim once again chose to tweak things at the back, while his substitution calls were all wrong as he once again adopted a safety-first approach instead of throwing the kitchen sink.

And skipper on the night, Lisandro Martinez was far from pleased with this attitude. In his post-match interview with Sky Sports, the Argentine did not hold back.

He claimed that the 20-time English league champions should be defeating this type of opposition at the Theatre of Dreams, and the lack of risk was an affront to what the club stands for.

‚ÄúReally disappointed. We can‚Äôt come here at home and draw this game. We have to win when we play at home. The opponent has to suffer and we didn‚Äôt get the three points.

‚ÄúVery frustrating. The team gave everything. Just for a few moments, we conceded in the last moment of the first half, that can happen. We can deserve that, it‚Äôs our responsibility.

‚ÄúWe played well with the ball in the first half but then we dropped too much, couldn‚Äôt press their centre backs. They were comfortable with the ball and they started moving round and creating spaces.

‚ÄúWolves don‚Äôt deserve the place they are, it‚Äôs a strong team. We respect them. We have to take more risks.

‚ÄúThe lads are very disappointed, we expect better. We have to take it and accept it and go for the next one.‚Äù

Not utilising all five subs, while changing things at the back instead of being bold has become a hallmark under Amorim.

A draw means the 20-time English league champions remain sixth in the table, squandering the opportunity to go fourth. Up next is a visit to Elland Road to play arch-rivals Leeds United.

Feature image Carl Recine via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: MMA Junkie's 2025 Coach of the Year: John Wood
description: John Wood helped lift Merab Dvalishvili to greatness, making him MMA Junkie's 2025 Coach of the Year.
fullText:
Individual sports often fail to highlight the team effort behind every athlete, and MMA is no different.

Fighters take the bulk of the glory when they get their hand raised in the cage, and rightfully so. But there's also a massive effort behind the scenes, including sparring partners, nutritionists, psychologists, and perhaps most importantly, coaches. This year, John Wood, owner and head coach of Syndicate MMA in Las Vegas, was behind the greatness¬†MMA Junkie's 2025 Fighter of the Year, Merab Dvalishvili,¬†plus many other standout performances.

Wood, a veteran coach, helped turn Dvalishvili from a champion unlikely to make a title defense, at least according to the odds and general perception, to one of the most dominant champions in the history of the UFC bantamweight division.

Dvalishvili entered UFC 311 in January as an underdog against challenger Umar Nurmagomedov. Yet, against the odds, Dvalishvili outworked Nurmagomedov over the course of 25 minutes, announcing to the world that he was here to stay, and earning a Fight of the Night award in the process.

The work didn't stop there for Wood. Dvalishvili wanted nothing to do with the typical championship calendar in the UFC, which often involves two title defenses. Wood had to go back to the drawing board and prep for three more championship fights, as Dvalishvili went for MMA history ‚Äì¬†trying to become the first ever to defend a UFC title four times in a calendar year.

Wood got Dvalishvili ready for UFC 316 in June. He not only dominated Sean O'Malley in the rematch, but this time he finished him, becoming the first to submit "Suga." It was a huge sign Dvalishvili had leveled up under Wood's wing. Dvalishvili would return four months later to face Cory Sandhagen at UFC 320 in October. Once again, he dominated, completely shutting down Sandhagen to tie the record for the most consecutive UFC bantamweight title defenses.

Fast-forward two months, and Wood was back again cornering a UFC championship fight ‚Äì¬†this time with Dvalishvili taking on former champion Petr Yan. Unfortunately for Dvalishvili and his camp, they fell short in their bid for history. Yan had the game plan to dethrone Dvalishvili. Yet, despite the defeat, Dvalishvili made a good account of himself, likely co-creating the best championship fight seen in the history of the UFC's bantamweight division.

It wasn't a perfect run for Dvalishvili in 2025, but it was a damn good one, and Wood was there every step of the way.

Wood also had his hand in many other big wins in 2025. He cornered Khalil Rountree's decision win over former champion Jamahal Hill at UFC Baku; Nazim Sadykhov's brutal KO wins over Ismael Bonfim and Nikolas Motta; Luana Santos' 2-0 run; and others.

Wood's fantastic work with "The Machine" along with other fighters is the reason why he's MMA Junkie's 2025 Coach of the Year.

This article originally appeared on MMA Junkie: John Wood names 2025 Coach of the Year

title: Sixers vs. Grizzlies: Final playing status for Joel Embiid on the road
description: Here is the final playing status for Joel Embiid as the Philadelphia 76ers take on the Memphis Grizzlies on Tuesday.
fullText:
The Philadelphia 76ers will wrap up the 2025 portion of their schedule on Tuesday when they take on the Memphis Grizzlies for the third game of their 5-game road trip. The Sixers will be looking to put a halt to a 3-game skid against a short-handed Grizzlies team missing a slew of pieces.

While the Sixers will still be without two key pieces as Kelly Oubre Jr. and Trendon Watford are working their way back from injuries, they will have their superstar big man on the floor.

Joel Embiid, who was listed as questionable against the Grizzlies due to a right ankle sprain along with right knee injury management, will play in this contest. With Memphis missing big men Zach Edey and Brandon Clarke, among a slew of others, this is a big chance for the Sixers to get their first win of the season when the Big 3 all play.

title: Every word of Ruben Amorim‚Äôs Wolverhampton Wanderers post-match press conference
description: Ruben Amorim says ‚Äúthere is no doubt in‚Äù his ‚Äúmind‚Äù that Manchester United will finish the season well.The United head coach was speaking at the post-match press conference following his sideÔøΩ...
fullText:
Ruben Amorim says ‚Äúthere is no doubt in‚Äù his ‚Äúmind‚Äù that Manchester United will finish the season well.

The United head coach was speaking at the post-match press conference following his side‚Äôs dismal 1-1 draw with Wolves at Old Trafford this evening.

The first question of the conference was whether Amorim feels the seven senior absences contributed to tonight‚Äôs poor result.

‚ÄúThat is normal, but we didn‚Äôt use that excuse against Newcastle,‚Äù Amorim replied.

‚ÄúWe are not going to use today. But of course, if you see the game, I understand why we play the way we play today, the lack of fluidity, lack of one against one. We knew that that would be a completely different game compared to Newcastle, because in Newcastle, we have more space to play. We didn‚Äôt have to work the play so much. And today, we have difficulties in that aspect and that is clear.‚Äù

The boss was then asked to explain why he had made a tactical tweak of reverting to three at the back, switching Patrick Dorgu back to the left.

‚ÄúNo, we knew that they will play with five. They will use it the width. And today was just to do that and then sometimes building up with him open or close with Luke Shaw doing the opposite,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúSo we try to arrange the right situations for the situation that we have in the moment.‚Äù

The next question came from the BBC‚Äôs Simon Stone.

‚ÄúRuben, you‚Äôve said a lot that you know that this team is not a finished article, but is this, tonight, an example that you need more creativity in your side? There was a lack of creativity, and it feels as though there‚Äôs some players within your squad who can‚Äôt give you what you need, and you need greater depth?‚Äù

‚ÄúNo, I think we are in one situation that you have a lot of players out in the same time. Of course, when you play Casemiro and Ugarte in the middle, you know that is different. When you have Kobbie Mainoo or Mason Mount or Bruno, that is normal. We just need to recover our players, the players from Afcon to return, and then the fluidity is going to be different.‚Äù

‚ÄúBut again, we won the last one and today we could win with the players that we have. We had lack of fluidity and then lack of quality and then lack of creation of chances. Then we suffered a goal with set pieces with the team, and we are tall in this moment. So these details are important to win these games in difficult moments.‚Äù

The next reporter asked Amorim if it was difficult to try to bring academy players in to the team in such difficult circumstances.

‚ÄúYeah, it‚Äôs completely different,‚Äù he agreed. ‚ÄúYou know that when there is a lot of new people in different positions and you put one young kid, he will struggle. It‚Äôs completely different when you have a base, everything is working well and you can give minutes to a young kid. You look at the game and you understand clearly and you see our team and you know that you are going to struggle in certain aspects. I think that was what happened during the game.‚Äù

The follow-up question was about the level of risk Amorim took in substituting the goalscorer Joshua Zirkzee at half-time.

‚ÄúWe need to do what the game was asking,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúWe were struggling. They put a lot of men in the middle of the park and we managed to do with Jack, we balanced that. I think we recover the ball faster in the second half. In the first half, we struggled a little bit to recover the ball. I‚Äôm just looking not for their age and the experience. In this moment, I just look what I can do to win the game.‚Äù

Was the Zirkzee substitution due to an injury or was it purely tactical? ‚ÄúNo, it was just tactical,‚Äù Amorim replied.

‚ÄúThe home form was encouraging at the start of the season, but that‚Äôs now one win in five at home, and most of the opponents have been from the lower end of the table. Is it an extra pressure being at home? Why do you think this is happening? It wasn‚Äôt just tonight, where it‚Äôs been a struggle.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt feel‚Ä¶ I think against Everton, we clearly underperformed,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWest Ham, we had some lack of creation, but we have our chances. Bournemouth, we had advantage three times. So it‚Äôs the details. It was not offensively, was not the creation of chances. We had the game. We had full control of the game. Today was completely different. Newcastle, we struggled, but we managed to win at home.‚Äù

‚ÄúI think this year, I don‚Äôt feel that. I feel the support of the fans when we are here. I feel that they want to play at home. I feel that we are dominant at home. We won one that they were a little bit more dominant, was the last one. Today, we had lack of quality, fluidity in the game today, and that was the reason of our game today.‚Äù

Simon Peach asked ‚ÄúAndy‚Äôs touched on the other point, home results. You‚Äôre only two points off of a potential Champions League spot at the halfway point of the season. How do you look at things going into the new year and how confident are you?‚Äù

‚ÄúI‚Äôm really confident. We just need to recover all the players and I‚Äôm really confident,‚Äù the boss smiled.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what is going to happen until the end of the season. Then we will make the resum√© of the season. But I‚Äôm really confident when we recover all the players that we are going to be a strong team. There is no doubt in my mind.‚Äù

Finally, asked whether anyone will be back for the next match against Leeds, he answered:

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know. I have to check. I‚Äôm not going to risk anyone to lose them for one month or two months. We will try to arrange the solutions. Again, let‚Äôs see, and we will try to win the next one with no risks for the players.‚Äù

Featured image Alex Livesey via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: MAAC Report: Takeaways from my trip to the Mount, its win over Iona, and more
description: EMMITSBURG, Md. ‚Äî I never actually thought that I would make the trip down to Mount St. Mary‚Äôs for a game. Over the last three four years that the Mount has been in the MAAC, as I‚Äôve made my schedule, I don‚Äôt even write their home games down on the list of games to choose [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
EMMITSBURG, Md. ‚Äî I never actually thought that I would make the trip down to Mount St. Mary‚Äôs for a game. Over the last three four years that the Mount has been in the MAAC, as I‚Äôve made my schedule, I don‚Äôt even write their home games down on the list of games to choose from. I‚Äôll probably continue to do that. It took a pretty extravagant effort to go in the first place on Monday, but I‚Äôm extremely pleased that I did.

While the rest of the schools in the conference are in urban or suburban settings, the Mount is plopped down a few miles from town on either side of Highway 15. There‚Äôs nothing around. On one side, the athletic complex. On the other side, all of the academic buildings. If you stand in just the right spot on the side of the athletic complex, you see the golden twinkle of the Statue of Blessed Mother, nestled amongst the hilly backdrop, rising high above the blue triangular facade of Knott Arena in the foreground. It‚Äôs a view unlike any other in the conference.

The arena itself transports you to a different era. Its unique architecture and wooden bleachers give it an energy that exudes historical importance, even though it‚Äôs merely a 38-year old building. Then you look up and see the massive new videoboard in one end zone, and the balcony-style hospitality seating in the other end zone.

Mount St. Mary‚Äôs athletic director Brad Davis has pushed renovations and changes to many parts of the building since he took over, but he also takes pride in the charm that it offers. He said that people tell him that Knott Arena is ‚Äúthe Hinkle of the MAAC.‚Äù I can‚Äôt say whether they‚Äôre right or not, but there‚Äôs an aura of mysticism that other venues in the conference just don‚Äôt have.

I‚Äôve made the trip. I successfully battled the cutting gusts attempting to sweep my Nissan Kicks off of its wheels to make it and watch a basketball game between the Mount and Iona. The Mountaineers grabbed a 66-59 victory ‚Äì their first MAAC win of the year ‚Äì riding two 10-point scoring runs in the second half. Here are three takeaways from each team

After missing the first 10 games of the season, Wofford transfer Anthony Arrington made his Mount debut against Loyola on Dec. 13. He slid right into the guard rotation on the bench, having played 21 minutes per contest over the last four.

In the second half on Monday, Arrington scored seven points in a row for the Mount as part of the first of the two 10-0 scoring runs. He gave the Mount a 42-41 lead with a corner three, and the building erupted.

He also played a role in bottling up Iona star CJ Anthony. He supplements Xavier Lipscomb‚Äôs physicality with another strong body off the bench, part of why the Mount was able to play the game that it wanted to play for a full 40.

‚ÄúWe were able to put guys on him that could match his physicality,‚Äù Donny Lind said. ‚ÄúWe made it uncomfortable for him as much as we could. He‚Äôs a really good player, and I was pleased with the effort we had.‚Äù

Arrington hasn‚Äôt been efficient offensively so far, but that second half stretch shows that he can provide a lift when needed.

Luke McEldon is 6-foot-10, 255 pounds but has skill beyond being a straight bruiser. That‚Äôs becoming a rare archetype in the MAAC and at the mid-major level, and he balled out on Monday with 18 points on 9-of-12 shooting from the field.

The Mount got him involved early and often. He got post-ups against Lamin Sabally ‚Äì whom he has two inches and 40 pounds on. He got dropoffs from the guards for layups, and he played with comfort and energy throughout the night.

‚ÄúWe usually try to get the ball inside as often as possible early in the game,‚Äù McEldon said. ‚ÄúAnd from there we can play on the outside.‚Äù

But on a night where the outside shots weren‚Äôt falling, it was McEldon and Justin Amadi pounding it down low all night. Even when McEldon picked up two fouls in the first half, Lind stuck with him for a few minutes, trusting him to not pick up a third while being the matchup problem that he is.

It‚Äôs going to be hard to top AK K√©b√©‚Äôs alley-oop dunk during the second 10-0 run when it comes to picking out the best slam of the year in the MAAC. Arlandus Keyes let go of the ball when Kebe was still a foot or two behind the 3-point line, but suddenly, Kebe appeared at the rim, sneaking past Alliou Fall to grab the ball where only he could get it and flush it home.

The Mount has scored six in a row and that was an ABSURD alley-oop from Arlandus Keyes to AK Kebe in transition. Kebe just glided through the air for that one and appeared at the rim for a monster slam.

Monster crowd reaction. Timeout Iona. 52-46

‚Äî Sam Federman (@Sam_Federman) December 30, 2025

It immediately forced an Iona timeout. The Knott Arena crowd was stunned. For a Mount St. Mary‚Äôs team that feeds off of energy and emotion ‚Äì as we saw in the MAAC Tournament ‚Äì it was a play that got the entire bench jumping.

‚ÄúIt was insane, it better be on SportsCenter,‚Äù Arrington said.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre working with him and focusing on those things that he can do that nobody else can,‚Äù Lind said. ‚ÄúWith his length and his athleticism, and the ability to get deflections, and the ability to make plays on defense that turn into offense, or a tip-in.‚Äù

It was just Kebe‚Äôs fifth game of the season, as he missed the first eight and the Loyola game, but the tantalizing moments are happening more often this year.

Iona leads the MAAC with 13 killshots (10-0 runs), and it even had one in the first half of this game. It nearly had another in the early part of the second half, scoring eight in a row to build a nine-point lead. However, the Gaels couldn‚Äôt stack possessions together in between runs once the threes stopped falling early on.

Then, in the second half, the Mount put together two killshots. One to take a 42-41 lead, and then one to take a 58-46 lead, essentially salting the game away by holding the Gaels scoreless for more than four minutes.

Like the Quinnipiac game, a physical MAAC opponent just wore them down in the second half. Dan Geriot looks at when the Gaels had a 41-32 lead as a missed opportunity.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs more like how do you keep hitting those singles, how do you keep pushing forward together?‚Äù Geriot said. ‚ÄúAnd a lot of the snowball that went the wrong way was based on our transition offense, and that‚Äôs something that we have seen a little bit before, so we need to understand that, feel that, see it on film and continue to converse with the guys about it.‚Äù

CJ Anthony might be the single best story in the MAAC this season. I‚Äôll tell you that story in a feature later this week. He took the league by storm in non-conference play but played his worst game of the season on Monday.

He‚Äôs essentially been able to control the game flow for Iona almost every night, and if he couldn‚Äôt, he‚Äôd hit a few big shots to make up for it. He didn‚Äôt have that against the Mount. He scored 10 points on 3-9 from the field, which isn‚Äôt a bad ‚Äúworst game,‚Äù but it certainly felt as though he didn‚Äôt have the impact that he usually does.

The Mount put a few different bodies on him, threw pressure at him and mitigated his impact, but it‚Äôs all part of the process for Geriot.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs him learning it,‚Äù Geriot said. ‚ÄúI talk about it all the time, we gotta go through this. Dealing with ball pressure is good for him, I believe we failed correctly tonight. I don‚Äôt believe we were out of sorts ‚Äì we were out of sorts with our passing, and that‚Äôs a big thing for us.‚Äù

As previously mentioned, McEldon had a great night for the Mount. Iona as a team is much better defending the perimeter than the paint, and the Mountaineers leveraged different ways to get in the paint and feed McEldon to exploit that.

Geriot thinks the Gaels need to read the plays better when the ball gets in the paint.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre giving up too much at the rim by overhelping,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe got to continue to read our help, and that‚Äôs how we become an elite defensive team.‚Äù

Siena‚Äôs staff definitely saw how the Mount created points at the basket, and would love to see Justice Shoats and Gavin Doty hit those dropoffs to Tassie Goodrick (should he play) and Antonio Chandler on Friday night.

Marist‚Äôs three MAAC games this year have been 72, 75, and now 68 possessions. Of the 21 that it played last year, only four of them were 68 or more possessions. Asim Jones has scored in double figures in six of the last seven games for Quinnipiac, and the one time that he didn‚Äôt is QU‚Äôs only loss in that stretch. While Tarik Watson and Jason Schofield can rack up points when they get the ball in the post, I don‚Äôt always feel like the best use of Marist‚Äôs possessions is playing through the bigs.

Merrimack was probably due for a better shooting night after going 26% and 27% against Princeton and Vermont, and Sacred Heart got caught in the crosshairs of that early. The Warriors started 5-0 last year, and are 3-0 to start this season despite five new starters. It was another 18 points and 7 assists for freshman point guard Kevair Kennedy, who is making a habit out of that at the moment. Sacred Heart is allowing opponents to shoot 61% inside the arc in MAAC play.

Davis Bynum had a game-high 19. He had just 17 total points on the season after the Broncs lost to Quinnipiac on Dec. 7. He‚Äôs now set season highs in four successive games. Perhaps Rider playing through him and Shemani Fuller more will lead to more success. But Manhattan got big bench production from Anthony Isaac and Terrance Jones. The Jaspers are still a thin team, but have two punches off the bench this year instead of just one.

Zaakir Williamson had his first double-double in a Saint Peter‚Äôs uniform, but the Peacock guards crashing the glass (eight rebounds for Bland, seven for Eaton) might be the story of the game. Fairfield is a tremendous rebounding team, and Saint Peter‚Äôs got in there and beat them on the glass. We know that Braden Sparks, Brandon Benjamin and Declan Wucherpfennig can put numbers on the board, but the Stags need to find consistent offense beyond those three.

title: Pistons vs Lakers Prediction, Picks & Best Bets for Tonight‚Äôs NBA Game
description: Pistons vs. Lakers predictions and NBA picks for Tuesday, December 30. LeBron James celebrates his 41st birthday by stuffing the box score.
fullText:
The Los Angeles Lakers halted a three-game losing streak with a win over the Sacramento Kings on Sunday and now look to make it two in a row when they host the Detroit Pistons on Tuesday, December 30.

Father Time may be undefeated, but LeBron James is still keeping him at bay. As he celebrates his 41st birthday, my Pistons vs. Lakers predictions and NBA picks anticipate another strong showing from King James.

Pistons vs Lakers best bet: LeBron James Over 35.5 points + rebounds + assists (-115)

LeBron James has played 10 games on his birthday throughout his career, averaging 32.9 points, 7.1 rebounds, and 6.9 assists, going for at least 35 PRA in every game played on December 30.

Since his streak of double-digit scoring games was snapped on December 4, James has averaged 25.4 points, 5.4 rebounds, and 5.9 assists across eight games. He‚Äôs reached 36 PRA in five of 14 games this season, including four of his last eight.

With Austin Reaves, Gabe Vincent, and Rui Hachimura sidelined for the Los Angeles Lakers, James will need to take on a larger role as a scorer, rebounder, and facilitator. Tonight‚Äôs tilt with the Detroit Pistons should feature plenty of points, which means additional opportunities for James to stuff the stat sheet.

James surely understands the gravity of this moment, as he‚Äôs playing in a record-setting 23rd season and taking the court, and I expect him to make a statement tonight on his 41st birthday, showing that age is just a number.

The Lakers are 19-11 to the Over, and the Pistons are 16-15-1 O/U.

Los Angeles has hit the Over in 11 of 13 home games, good for the highest percentage in the Association. The Lakers have gone Over in four of five as the home underdog. Detroit has hit the Over in two of its last three outings, including high-scoring matchups against the Utah Jazz and Sacramento Kings.

The Pistons should be motivated to snap a two-game skid when they visit Crypto.com Arena tonight.

Detroit most recently fell to the Los Angeles Clippers thanks to a career-high 55 points from Kawhi Leonard, and lost to the Utah Jazz on a go-ahead bucket from Keyonte George in the game before that.

With the Lakers missing several key players, the Pistons have the edge to snap the short losing streak before it gets out of hand.

LeBron James Over 35.5 points + rebounds + assists

Cade Cunningham is averaging 26.5 points per game this season, and he's hit the Over on this scoring line in 15 of 29 games, including two straight. He's scored 26+ in 10 of 17 games on the road, and he's reached that mark in four of his last six outside of Little Caesars Arena.

LeBron James Over 35.5 points + rebounds + assists

Cade Cunningham Over 25.5 points

Spread: Pistons -2.5 (-110) | Lakers +2.5 (-110)

Moneyline: Pistons -140 | Lakers +120

Over/Under: Over 232 (-110) | Under 232 (-110)

The Los Angeles Lakers have hit the Game Total Over in 34 of their last 55 games (+10.90 Units / 18% ROI). Find more¬†NBA betting trends for Pistons vs. Lakers.

Crypto.com Arena, Los Angeles, CA

title: Real Madrid Lead UEFA Coefficient Rankings Ahead of Europe‚Äôs Elite
description: Real Madrid continue to set the benchmark in European football, sitting atop the latest UEFA club coefficient rankings ahead of Bayern Munich and Inter Milan. The standings, calculated based on performances in European competitions over the past five seasons, once again underline Madrid‚Äôs sustained dominance on the continental stage. According to the figures published by [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Real Madrid continue to set the benchmark in European football, sitting atop the latest UEFA club coefficient rankings ahead of Bayern Munich and Inter Milan. The standings, calculated based on performances in European competitions over the past five seasons, once again underline Madrid‚Äôs sustained dominance on the continental stage.

According to the figures published by UEFA, Real Madrid lead the rankings with 131,500 points, a significant margin over second-placed Bayern Munich (124,250) and Inter Milan (121,250). The top six is rounded out by Manchester City (117,750), Liverpool (115,500), and reigning Champions League winners Paris Saint-Germain (109,500).

The UEFA club coefficient is determined by results in the Champions League, Europa League, and Conference League over a rolling five-year period. During that time, Real Madrid have lifted the Champions League trophy twice, a key factor in their commanding position at the top of the rankings.

The list also highlights the balance of power across Europe‚Äôs major leagues. Among the top ten clubs, there are:

Two Spanish teams: Real Madrid (1st) and Barcelona (9th)

Three German teams: Bayern Munich, Borussia Dortmund, and Bayer Leverkusen

Three English teams: Manchester City, Liverpool, and Arsenal

One French team: Paris Saint-Germain

For Real Madrid, the numbers are less a surprise than a confirmation. Across eras, managers, and squads, the club continues to turn European nights into a competitive advantage. While others rise and fall with cycles of success, Madrid‚Äôs consistency over the last five years reinforces their reputation as the defining force in European football.

title: Michigan State's pre-portal roster projection: Special teams
description: Looking at Michigan State's pre-portal roster status, turning to the special teams, who need a lot of portal help.
fullText:
Michigan State football is gearing up for a roster overhaul, with new head coach Pat Fitzgerald needing to put together his first roster in East Lansing through the transfer portal. With the transfer portal opening on Jan. 2, and only lasting for two weeks, it will be imperative to make a strong and immediate impact.

The first step to shoring up the roster is evaluating the members of MSU's roster that will be retained, while identifying the needs to plug holes in the starting lineup.

Taking a look at the position groups on the¬†Spartans¬†roster, it will distinguish who the team may be pursuing when the portal opens at the turn of the new year.

After breaking down the offensive roster, the time has come to look at the specialists, and what new special teams coordinator LeVar Woods is going to have deal with for his first season in East Lansing.

Now, the Spartans are going to have to deal with the loss of Ryan Eckley to the NFL Draft and Martin Connington to the transfer portal, shaking up the room big time.

Outlook: Luckily, Michigan State has a very good, young long snapper in Wills, who can lock down the position that's importance is very under the radar. Unluckily, the staff needs both a kicker and a punter out of the transfer portal (or the 2026 recruiting class) because both positions are vacant on the depth chart.

title: Lucas V√°zquez Makes Quiet Return to Valdebebas During Real Madrid‚Äôs Christmas Training
description: Lucas V√°zquez was one of the most meaningful presences at Real Madrid‚Äôs Christmas training session, even if his return went largely unnoticed by the public. While thousands of fans filled the Alfredo Di St√©fano Stadium for the club‚Äôs open training day, the Galician chose a far more discreet route, staying out of sight and away [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Lucas V√°zquez was one of the most meaningful presences at Real Madrid‚Äôs Christmas training session, even if his return went largely unnoticed by the public. While thousands of fans filled the Alfredo Di St√©fano Stadium for the club‚Äôs open training day, the Galician chose a far more discreet route, staying out of sight and away from the spotlight.

V√°zquez visited Real Madrid City in Valdebebas, where he reunited privately with former teammates and spent time greeting members of the coaching staff.

Now a player for Bayer Leverkusen, V√°zquez used the opportunity to wish the squad luck ahead of the upcoming season.

Having grown up within the club‚Äôs system and spent the prime years of his career wearing white, V√°zquez remains closely connected to Madrid despite his current chapter in Germany. His quiet visit served as a reminder that, for some players, the relationship with the club extends far beyond contracts and competition.

title: Illinois comes away with big-time defensive touchdown
description: Strip sack and score in the Music City Bowl.
fullText:
NASHVILLE ‚Äî The Liberty Mutual Music City Bowl was originally predicted to be a battle between two offensive juggernauts.

In reality, Illinois‚Äô defense had one of the most highlight-worthy plays of the game early in the third quarter.

It all started with a strip sack from sophomore linebacker Joe Barna at around the Tennessee 15-yard line, which sent defensive lineman James Thompson Jr. and linebacker Leon Lowery Jr. scampering after the fumble.

After a major dogpile of Illini and Volunteers in the end zone, it would be none other than Lowery who came away with it, putting points on the board for Illinois.

‚Äî Tajh (@JimmyTheGreek01) December 31, 2025

Following the play, Thompson was slow to get up and had to get looked at by the Illinois training staff, but was eventually able to walk off the field under his own power.

The defensive touchdown could end up proving to be a game-changing play, as it put the Illini ahead by double-digits at the time.
